###############################################################################
# MAP EVENTS
###############################################################################

#==============================================================================
Map ID: 001
Map Name: Intro
Tileset: 004: Poke Center
Width: 20, Height: 15

#------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Event ID: 001
Event Name: Modified Essentials Intro
(X,Y): (003,014)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Text: \l[3]Which adventure would you like to play? This cannot
 :    : be changed without starting a new game.
@>Show Choices: Pokemon Essentials, Touhoumon Essentials
(When Cancel: Disallow)
: When [Pokemon Essentials]
 @>Control Self Switch: A =ON
 @>
: When [Touhoumon Essentials]
 @>Control Self Switch: B =ON
 @>
: Branch End
@>

Page #2
Conditions
Self Switch A is ON

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Autorun

List of Event Commands:
@>Comment: --- Pokemon Essentials Intro ---
@>Change Text Options: Middle, Hide
@>Text: <ac>\c[8]\l[3](Please refer to the\nPokémon 
 :    : Essentials Wiki\nfor documentation.)
@>Change Text Options: Bottom, Show
@>Prepare for Transition
@>Play BGM: 'begin', 100, 100
@>Show Picture: 1, 'introbg', Upper Left (0,0), (100%,100%), 255, Normal
@>Execute Transition
@>Wait: 18 frame(s)
@>Show Picture: 2, 'introbase', Center (256,256), (100%,100%), 0, Normal
@>Show Picture: 3, 'introOak', Center (256,172), (100%,100%), 0, Normal
@>Move Picture: 2, @15, Center (256,256), (100%,100%), 255, Normal
@>Move Picture: 3, @15, Center (256,172), (100%,100%), 255, Normal
@>Wait: 18 frame(s)
@>Text: \bHello! Sorry to keep you waiting!
@>Text: \bWelcome to the world of Pokémon.
@>Text: \bMy name is Oak.
@>Text: \bPeople call me the Pokémon Professor.
@>Label: Help Choices
@>Text: \bIf you need help, I am certainly capable of giving it.
@>Show Choices: Controls, Adventure, No info needed
(When Cancel: Choice 3)
: When [Controls]
 @>Script: pbEventScreen(ButtonEventScene)
 @>Jump to Label: Help Choices
 @>
: When [Adventure]
 @>Text: \bWell then, without further ado...
 @>Script: pbToneChangeAll(Tone.new(-255,-255,-255,0),10)
 @>Wait: 10 frame(s)
 @>Show Picture: 4, 'helpadventurebg', Upper Left (0,0), (100%,100%), 0, Normal
 @>Move Picture: 4, @10, Upper Left (0,0), (100%,100%), 255, Normal
 @>Wait: 10 frame(s)
 @>Change Text Options: Middle, Hide
 @>Text: <ac>\c[0]\l[3]You are about to enter a world\nwhere 
  :    : you will embark on a grand\nadventure of your very 
  :    : own.
 @>Text: <ac>\c[0]\l[5]Speak to people and check things\n
  :    : wherever you go, be it in towns,\nroads or caves.\n
  :    : Gather information and hints from\n
  :    : every possible source.
 @>Text: <ac>\c[0]\l[3]New paths will open to you when\n
  :    : you help people in need, overcome\n
  :    : challenges, and solve mysteries.
 @>Text: <ac>\c[0]\l[7]At times, you will be challenged\n
  :    : by others to a battle.\n
  :    : At other times, wild creatures\nmay stand in your way.\n\n
  :    : By overcoming such hurdles,\nyou will gain great power.
 @>Text: <ac>\c[0]\l[2]However, your adventure is not\n
  :    : solely about becoming powerful.
 @>Text: <ac>\c[0]\l[7]On your travels, we hope that\n
  :    : you will meet countless people\n
  :    : and, through them, achieve\npersonal growth.\n\n
  :    : This is the most important\nobjective of this adventure.
 @>Move Picture: 4, @10, Upper Left (0,0), (100%,100%), 0, Normal
 @>Wait: 10 frame(s)
 @>Erase Picture: 4
 @>Script: pbToneChangeAll(Tone.new(0,0,0,0),10)
 @>Wait: 10 frame(s)
 @>Change Text Options: Bottom, Show
 @>Jump to Label: Help Choices
 @>
: When [No info needed]
 @>
: Branch End
@>Wait: 5 frame(s)
@>Move Picture: 3, @10, Center (256,172), (100%,100%), 0, Normal
@>Wait: 10 frame(s)
@>Erase Picture: 3
@>Show Picture: 3, 'introMarill', Center (256,220), (100%,100%), 0, Normal
@>Move Picture: 3, @10, Center (256,220), (100%,100%), 255, Normal
@>Wait: 10 frame(s)
@>Text: \bThis world is inhabited by creatures we call 
 :    : Pokémon.
@>Text: \bPeople and Pokémon live together by supporting 
 :    : each other.
@>Text: \bSome people play with Pokémon, some battle with 
 :    : them.
@>Wait: 5 frame(s)
@>Move Picture: 3, @10, Center (256,220), (100%,100%), 0, Normal
@>Wait: 10 frame(s)
@>Erase Picture: 3
@>Show Picture: 3, 'introOak', Center (256,172), (100%,100%), 0, Normal
@>Move Picture: 3, @10, Center (256,172), (100%,100%), 255, Normal
@>Wait: 10 frame(s)
@>Text: \bBut we don't know everything about Pokémon yet.
@>Text: \bThere are still many mysteries to solve.
@>Text: \bThat's why I study Pokémon every day.
@>Wait: 5 frame(s)
@>Move Picture: 2, @10, Center (256,256), (100%,100%), 0, Normal
@>Move Picture: 3, @10, Center (256,172), (100%,100%), 0, Normal
@>Wait: 10 frame(s)
@>Erase Picture: 3
@>Wait: 15 frame(s)
@>Show Picture: 3, 'Character Selection', Center (256,192), (100%,100%), 0, Normal
@>Move Picture: 2, @10, Center (256,256), (100%,100%), 255, Normal
@>Move Picture: 3, @10, Center (256,192), (100%,100%), 255, Normal
@>Text: \bSo, who are you?
@>Show Choices: Renko, Maribel
(When Cancel: Disallow)
: When [Renko]
 @>Comment: Initializes player 0 (PlayerA).
  :       : ["pbChangePlayer" takes a value from 0 through 7; 
  :       : other values are not valid. To edit information about 
  :       : a player, choose "Set Metadata" in the Pokemon 
  :       : Essentials Editor and select "Global".]
 @>Script: pbChangePlayer(0)
 @>Show Picture: 3, 'introRenko', Center (256,192), (100%,100%), 0, Normal
 @>
: When [Maribel]
 @>Comment: initializes player 1 (PlayerB)
 @>Script: pbChangePlayer(1)
 @>Show Picture: 3, 'introMaribel', Center (256,192), (100%,100%), 0, Normal
 @>
: Branch End
@>Move Picture: 2, @10, Center (256,256), (100%,100%), 255, Normal
@>Move Picture: 3, @10, Center (256,192), (100%,100%), 255, Normal
@>Wait: 10 frame(s)
@>Text: \bNow what did you say your name was?
@>Label: Enter Name
@>Comment: Opens the name entry screen and initializes the 
 :       : trainer object
@>Script: pbTrainerName
@>Wait: 5 frame(s)
@>Text: \bSo you're \PN?
@>Show Choices: Yes, No
(When Cancel: Choice 2)
: When [Yes]
 @>
: When [No]
 @>Text: \bWhat is your name?
 @>Jump to Label: Enter Name
 @>
: Branch End
@>Text: \b\PN, are you ready?
@>Text: \bYour very own Pokémon story is about to unfold.
@>Text: \bYou'll face fun times and tough challenges.
@>Text: \bA world of dreams and adventures with Pokémon 
 :    : awaits! Let's go!
@>Text: \bEnjoy the Starter Kit. You should give credit when 
 :    : using it.
@>Fade Out BGM: 4 sec.
@>Control Self Switch: A =ON
@>Script: pbToneChangeAll(Tone.new(-255,-255,-255,0),20)
@>Wait: 20 frame(s)
@>Erase Picture: 1
@>Erase Picture: 2
@>Erase Picture: 3
@>Transfer Player:[003: Introduction Sequence], (025,006), Down
@>Script: pbToneChangeAll(Tone.new(0,0,0,0),20)
@>Wait: 20 frame(s)
@>

Page #3
Conditions
Self Switch B is ON

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Autorun

List of Event Commands:
@>Comment: --- Touhoumon Essentials Intro ---
@>Change Text Options: Middle, Hide
@>Text: \l[3]Touhoumon Essentials was made by 
 :    : DerxwnaKapsyla. If you use this Development Kit, 
 :    : please give credit.
@>Text: \l[4]Also, please give credit to the people who helped to 
 :    : make Pokemon Essentials. If it wasn't for them, this 
 :    : would not exist right now.
@>Wait: 5 frame(s)
@>Text: <ac>\l[3](Please refer to the\nPokémon 
 :    : Essentials Wiki\nfor documentation.)
@>Change Text Options: Bottom, Show
@>Prepare for Transition
@>Script: pbChangePlayer(2)
@>Play BGM: 'W-001. Memory of Forgathering Dream', 70, 100
@>Show Picture: 1, 'introbg', Upper Left (0,0), (100%,100%), 255, Normal
@>Execute Transition
@>Wait: 18 frame(s)
@>Show Picture: 2, 'introbase', Center (256,256), (100%,100%), 0, Normal
@>Show Picture: 3, 'introOak', Center (256,172), (100%,100%), 0, Normal
@>Move Picture: 2, @15, Center (256,256), (100%,100%), 255, Normal
@>Move Picture: 3, @15, Center (256,172), (100%,100%), 255, Normal
@>Wait: 18 frame(s)
@>Text: Hello! Sorry to keep you waiting!
@>Text: Welcome to Monsekai, the world of Pokémon and 
 :    : Puppets.
@>Text: My name is Oak.
@>Text: People call me the Pokémon Professor, but I study 
 :    : Puppets now too.
@>Wait: 5 frame(s)
@>Move Picture: 3, @10, Center (256,172), (100%,100%), 0, Normal
@>Wait: 10 frame(s)
@>Erase Picture: 3
@>Show Picture: 3, 'introMarill', Center (256,220), (100%,100%), 0, Normal
@>Move Picture: 3, @10, Center (256,220), (100%,100%), 255, Normal
@>Wait: 10 frame(s)
@>Text: This world is inhabited by various creatures far 
 :    : and wide. Some are Pokémon...
@>Move Picture: 3, @10, Center (256,220), (100%,100%), 0, Normal
@>Wait: 10 frame(s)
@>Erase Picture: 3
@>Show Picture: 3, 'introGoliath', Center (256,190), (100%,100%), 0, Normal
@>Move Picture: 3, @10, Center (256,190), (100%,100%), 255, Normal
@>Text: ...And others are Puppets.
@>Text: Some people go out and capture these wondrous 
 :    : creatures. Some play with them like pets, some 
 :    : battle with them. There are all sorts of possibilities!
@>Wait: 5 frame(s)
@>Move Picture: 3, @10, Center (256,190), (100%,100%), 0, Normal
@>Wait: 10 frame(s)
@>Erase Picture: 3
@>Show Picture: 3, 'introOak', Center (256,172), (100%,100%), 0, Normal
@>Move Picture: 3, @10, Center (256,172), (100%,100%), 255, Normal
@>Wait: 10 frame(s)
@>Text: But we don't know everything about these beings.
@>Text: There are still many mysteries to solve.
@>Text: That's why I study every day.
@>Wait: 5 frame(s)
@>Move Picture: 2, @10, Center (256,256), (100%,100%), 0, Normal
@>Move Picture: 3, @10, Center (256,172), (100%,100%), 0, Normal
@>Wait: 10 frame(s)
@>Erase Picture: 3
@>Wait: 15 frame(s)
@>Show Picture: 3, 'introBoy', Center (256,178), (100%,100%), 0, Normal
@>Move Picture: 2, @10, Center (256,256), (100%,100%), 255, Normal
@>Move Picture: 3, @10, Center (256,178), (100%,100%), 255, Normal
@>Script: pbChangePlayer(2)
@>Script: pbTrainerName("Red")
@>Text: It's time for your journey to continue, Red.
@>Text: The vast and wondrous world of Pokémon and
 :    : Puppets awaits you! Just go out there and lay
 :    : claim to it once again!
@>Fade Out BGM: 4 sec.
@>Control Self Switch: A =ON
@>Script: pbToneChangeAll(Tone.new(-255,-255,-255,0),20)
@>Wait: 20 frame(s)
@>Text: Red: ...
@>Script: pbAddToPartySilent(:REIMU,67)
:       : pbAddToPartySilent(:CHEN,65)
@>Script: pbUnlockDex
@>Script: $Trainer.pokegear=true
:       : $PokemonGlobal.runningShoes=true
@>Wait: 20 frame(s)
@>Erase Picture: 1
@>Erase Picture: 2
@>Erase Picture: 3
@>Play SE: 'Exit Door', 80, 100
@>Transfer Player:[042: Fuchsia City], (013,043), Down
@>Script: Kernel.pbSetPokemonCenter
@>Script: pbToneChangeAll(Tone.new(0,0,0,0),20)
@>Wait: 20 frame(s)
@>

#------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Event ID: 002
Event Name: Quick start intro
(X,Y): (000,014)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Comment: This is the Debug intro, used to quickly start a game. 
 :       : The player's name and trainer type are chosen 
 :       : automatically.
@>Script: pbChangePlayer(0)
@>Script: pbTrainerName("Red")
@>Control Self Switch: A =ON
@>Transfer Player:[003: Introduction Sequence], (025,006), Down, No Fade
@>Script: pbToneChangeAll(Tone.new(0,0,0,0),20)
@>

#------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Event ID: 004
Event Name: Asteria Intro
(X,Y): (000,000)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Autorun

List of Event Commands:
@>Text: \l[3]Would you like to proceed through Asteria's intro? Skipping this
 :    : segment has no impact on gameplay.
@>Show Choices: Yes, No
(When Cancel: Choice 2)
: When [Yes]
 @>Comment: --- Jump to Cargo Ship
 @>Wait: 10 frame(s)
 @>Script: pbFadeOutIn(99999) { PreludeScene.new }
 @>Wait: 10 frame(s)
 @>Change Transparent Flag: Transparency
 @>Script: pbChangePlayer(2)
 @>Script: pbTrainerName("Red")
 @>Script: $Trainer.has_pokegear = true
 :       : $Trainer.has_running_shoes = true
 :       : $Trainer.pokedex.unlock(-1)
 :       : $Trainer.pokedex.unlock(0)
 :       : $Trainer.pokedex.unlock(1)
 @>Transfer Player:[006: Cargo Ship], (013,021)
 @>
: When [No]
 @>Control Variables: [0106: Red vs. Chen] = 1
 @>Script: pbChangePlayer(0)
 @>Comment: --- Jump to Renko and Maribel's house
 @>Change Screen Color Tone: (-255,-255,-255,255), @20
 @>Change Transparent Flag: Transparency
 @>Control Switches: [0105: Intro Control Switch] = ON
 @>Wait: 10 frame(s)
 @>Script: NewGameScene.new
 @>Wait: 10 frame(s)
 @>Transfer Player:[015: Renko & Maribel's House], (033,004), Down
 @>
: Branch End
@>Control Self Switch: A =ON
@>

Page #2
Conditions
Switch 0105: Intro Control Switch is ON

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Wait: 20 frame(s)
@>Script: pbSetSelfSwitch(3,"A",true)
:       : pbSetSelfSwitch(4,"A",true)
@>Script: pbSetSelfSwitch2(7,8,"B",true)
:       : pbSetSelfSwitch2(7,16,"B",true)
@>Control Self Switch: A =ON
@>

#------------------------------------------------------------------------------

#==============================================================================
Map ID: 002
Map Name: Prefab Map
Tileset: 025: Outside (Alternate)
Width: 20, Height: 15

#------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Event ID: 001
Event Name: Basic Door - Automatic
(X,Y): (001,002)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Graphic: doors3

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Player Touch

List of Event Commands:
@>Set Move Route: This event
                  (Ignore If Can't Move)
 :              : $>SE: 'Automatic Door', 100, 100
 :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
 :              : $>Turn Left
 :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
 :              : $>Turn Right
 :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
 :              : $>Turn Up
 :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Set Move Route: Player
                  (Ignore If Can't Move)
 :              : $>Through ON
 :              : $>Move Up
 :              : $>Through OFF
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Change Transparent Flag: Transparency
@>Set Move Route: This event
                  (Ignore If Can't Move)
 :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
 :              : $>Turn Right
 :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
 :              : $>Turn Left
 :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
 :              : $>Turn Down
 :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Change Screen Color Tone: (-255,-255,-255,0), @6
@>Wait: 8 frame(s)
@>Change Transparent Flag: Normal

 : Else

 :       : $Trainer.party.compact!
 :       : for i in 0...party.length
 :       :   species = party[i]
 @>Script:   $Trainer.party[i] = pbNewPkmn(species,7)
 :       :   $Trainer.seen[species]  = true # Set this species to seen and owned
 :       :   $Trainer.owned[species] = true
 :       : end 
 @>Script: pbTrainerBattle(:SCIENTIST,"Debug",nil,nil,0)
 @>Control Variables: [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] = 5
 @>
: Else
 @>
: Branch End
@>Conditional Branch: Variable [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] == 1
 @>Script: BattleScripting.setInScript("turnStart0",:Catching_Start)
 @>Script: BattleScripting.setInScript("halfHPOpp",:Catching_Catch)
 @>Script: party = []
 :       : species = [:PIKACHU]
 :       : for id in species
 :       :   party.push(getConst(PBSpecies,id)) if hasConst?(PBSpecies,id)
 @>Script: end
 :       : # Species IDs of the Pokémon to be created
 :       :   for i in 0...$Trainer.party.length
 :       :   $Trainer.party[i]=nil
 @>Script: end
 :       : $Trainer.party.compact!
 :       : for i in 0...party.length
 :       :   species = party[i]
 @>Script:   $Trainer.party[i] = pbNewPkmn(species,7)
 :       :   $Trainer.seen[species]  = true # Set this species to seen and owned
 :       :   $Trainer.owned[species] = true
 :       : end
 @>Script: TrainerDialogue.set("lowHPOpp","halfHPOpp")
 @>Script: pbWildBattle(:PIDGEY,5)
 @>Control Variables: [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] = 5
 @>
: Else
 @>
: Branch End
@>Conditional Branch: Variable [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] == 2
 @>Script: BattleScripting.setInScript("sendout1Opp",:Opal_Send1)
 @>Script: BattleScripting.setInScript("sendout2Opp",:Opal_Send2)
 @>Script: BattleScripting.setInScript("sendout3Opp",:Opal_Send3)
 @>Script: BattleScripting.setInScript("lastOpp",:Opal_Last)
 @>Script: BattleScripting.setInScript("megaOpp",:Opal_Mega)
 @>Script: BattleScripting.setInScript("attackOpp,4",:Opal_LastAttack)
 @>Script: for i in 0...$Trainer.party.length
 :       :   $Trainer.party[i].level=38
 :       : end
 @>Control Variables: [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] = 5
 @>Script: pbTrainerBattle(:CHAMPION,"Blue",nil,nil,0)
 @>
: Branch End
@>Conditional Branch: Variable [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] == 3
 @>Script: $PokemonGlobal.nextBattleBGM="BrockBattle"
 @>Script: # Simple text change for showing that this is the 2nd time you're challening Brock
 :       : TrainerDialogue.set("battleStart","You challenge Gym Leader Brock for the 2nd time!")
 @>Script: BattleScripting.setInScript("last",:Brock_LastPlayer)
 @>Script: TrainerDialogue.set("turnStart0",Proc.new{|battle|
 :       : # At the start of the Battle, set Geodude's item to Ring Target.
 :       : # Allows the Pikachu to hit Geodude with Electric Attacks. Plot Armor 100
 :       : battle.battlers[1].item=getID(PBItems,:RINGTARGET)
 :       : })
 @>Script: BattleScripting.setInScript("smlDamageOpp",:Brock_MockPlayer)
 @>Script: BattleScripting.setInScript("recall",:Brock_GiveUp)
 @>Script: TrainerDialogue.set("fainted","Are you giving up already, \\PN?")
 @>Script: BattleScripting.setInScript("halfHP,2",:Brock_Sprinklers)
 @>Script: TrainerDialogue.copy("lowHP,2","halfHP,2")
 @>Script: BattleScripting.setInScript("lowHPOpp,2",:Brock_Forfeit)
 @>Script: party = []
 :       : species = [:PIDGEOTTO,:PIKACHU]
 :       : for id in species
 :       :   party.push(getConst(PBSpecies,id)) if hasConst?(PBSpecies,id)
 @>Script: end
 :       : # Species IDs of the Pokémon to be created
 :       :   for i in 0...$Trainer.party.length
 :       :   $Trainer.party[i]=nil
 @>Script: end
 :       : $Trainer.party.compact!
 :       : for i in 0...party.length
 :       :   species = party[i]
 @>Script:   $Trainer.party[i] = pbNewPkmn(species,12)
 :       :   $Trainer.seen[species]  = true # Set this species to seen and owned
 :       :   $Trainer.owned[species] = true
 :       : end
 @>Script: $Trainer.party[1].pbLearnMove(:AGILITY)
 :       : $Trainer.party[1].pbLearnMove(:SLAM)
 :       : $Trainer.party[1].pbLearnMove(:IRONTAIL)
 :       : $Trainer.party[1].pbLearnMove(:THUNDERBOLT)
 @>Script: $Trainer.party[0].pbLearnMove(:GUST)
 :       : $Trainer.party[0].pbLearnMove(:WINGATTACK)
 :       : $Trainer.party[0].pbLearnMove(:SANDATTACK)
 :       : $Trainer.party[0].pbLearnMove(:TACKLE)
 @>Control Variables: [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] = 5
 @>Script: TrainerDialogue.set("rand10","Ass")
 @>Script: pbTrainerBattle(:LEADER_Brock,"Brock",nil,nil,0)
 @>
: Branch End
@>Conditional Branch: Self Switch A == OFF
 @>Text: Hello there! If you're reading this, you're using the Mid
  :    :  Battle Dialogue script by Golisopod User.
 @>Text: Here are a few example battles created using this 
  :    : script. These are included to check out the various
  :    : ways this script can be used to make interesting
  :    : Trainer Battles using Procs.
 @>Text: I'd suggest reading every single line and comment in
  :    : the Procs to get and idea of what this script can do.
 @>Text: You should definitely give credit when using this script.
 @>Text: Have Fun!
 @>Control Self Switch: A =ON
 @>
: Branch End
@>

@>Text: \xn[Gabby]Welcome back to our continued broadcast of the ongoing global crisis.\wtnp[40]
@>Text: \xn[Gabby]We're reporting live from the emergency confrence held in Lumiose City.\wtnp[40]
@>Text: \xn[Gabby]Leaders and important figures from across the world have gathered here.\wtnp[40]
@>Text: \xn[Gabby]Today marks day 35 of our continued coverage of the confrence.\wtnp[40]
@>Text: \xn[Gabby]To our knowledge not a whole lot has changed since the last report.\wtnp[40]
@>Text: \xn[Gabby]For those of you just tuning in...\wtnp[40]
@>Text: \xn[Gabby]This confrence was called in response to the current ongoing crisis.\wtnp[40]
@>Text: \xn[Gabby]Over two months ago, an unknown invasive species appeared out of nowhere.\wtnp[40]
@>Text: \xn[Gabby]The number of these species have increased throughout the Hoenn Region...\wtnp[40]
@>Text: \xn[Gabby]... and have been spotted in other regions as well.\wtnp[40]
@>Text: \xn[Gabby]According to officials, these creatures are definitely not Pokemon.\wtnp[40]
@>Text: \xn[Gabby]But beyond that everything else about them is entirely unknown.\wtnp[40]
@>Text: \xn[Gabby]Where they came from, what they're capable of, it remains a mystery.\wtnp[40]
@>Text: \xn[Gabby]Now, earlier this afternoon we recieved an tip from an anonymous source.\wtnp[40]
@>Text: \l[3]\xn[Gabby]It appears that Professor Samuel Oak will be proposing an idea to the council today.\wtnp[40]
@>Text: \xn[Gabby]However, as of this moment, we have not verified these claims, or this idea.\wtnp[40]
@>Text: \xn[Gabby]We will be bringing you the latest news as we have it.\wtnp[40]
@>Text: \xn[Gabby]This is Gabby of Hoenn TV, reporting once again from the emergency confrence.\wtnp[40]
@>Text: \xn[Gabby]Back to you in the studio, Dave.\wtnp[40]
@>Text: \se[Tile Game cursor]*Click*\wtnp[40]
@>Control Self Switch: A =ON
@>

Event Name: NPC
(X,Y): (015,023)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Graphic: trainer_COOLTRAINER_F

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Text: Oh, Red! Welcome home! It's been a while, hasn't it?
@>Text: Are you planning to stay for a while? You should 
 :    : come check out the General Store while you're in 
 :    : town.
@>Text: My grandparents opened it up not long ago and they 
 :    : could use the customers!
@>

Page #2
Conditions
Switch 0105: Intro Control Switch is ON

Graphic: trainer_COOLTRAINER_F

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Conditional Branch: Self Switch A == OFF
 @>Text: Oh, hello there! You must be \PN! I heard about you from Red's mother last night!
 @>Control Self Switch: A =ON
 @>
: Else
 @>
: Branch End
@>Text: This is the Pallet Town General Store, a shop my grandparents opened up to sell utilities for all sorts of trainers.
@>Text: Right now our stock is fairly limited, but if you come back in the future, we should have more in stock!
@>Text: Our plan is to stock more and more items, and as we get more stock, start selling older items at a discount.
@>Text: We hope that when we have more stock, you'll come see us again!
@>

 :    : reasons we can't even begin to theorize about.
@>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]It's almost like some sort of inate, primal instinct, despite Puppets not showing any sort of hostility.
@>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]As a result of that, the Pokémon Adoption Agency headquarters in the Kikoto
 :    : Continent has temporarily closed their doors, and they've rebranded as a Pokémon Preservation Complex.
@>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]Their current goal is to bring in displaced Pokémon so they can be helped to
 :    : relocate, and potentially rehabilitate.
@>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]Another one of my disciples, Blue, works down there as well. She's kept me up to date with their operations.

@>Wait: 15 frame(s)
@>Move Picture: 1, @20, Upper Left (0,0), (100%,100%), 0, Normal
@>Scroll Map: Up, 15, 2
@>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]In response to this unprecidented crisis, the various leaders of the world were 
 :    : rounded up to discuss what to do about this situation...
@>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]There were some... heavy words thrown around, mostly by public opinion as a result of the media's coverage.
@>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]The whole process lasted for a little over a month.
@>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]While this was going on, the entire scientific community was working behind the 
 :    : scenes to study these creatures.
@>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]It was on us to find out as much as we could about them, and reveal our findings to the council.
@>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]The result of our research? The creatures, while they share no known land
 :    : of origin, or any comparable evolutionary background to Pokémon, were unmistakably
 :    : similar to Pokémon.
@>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]Similar characteristics, similar abilities, even Pokéballs managed to recognise
 :    : them without any sort of calibration.
@>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]Our best theory was that they came from another dimension or universe, similar to 
 :    : the subjects of the missing Professor Mohn of the Alola Region.
@>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]Of course, we had no way to confirm or deny that, and without conclusive proof, that hypothesis was dismissed.
@>Move Picture: 1, @20, Upper Left (0,0), (100%,100%), 255, Normal
@>Wait: 20 frame(s)
@>Change Transparent Flag: Transparency
@>Transfer Player:[012: Cutscene: Confrence Hall], (010,008)
@>Set Event Location: [Professor Oak],(010,010), Up
@>Change Screen Color Tone: (-40,-40,-40,255), @20
@>Comment: ---------
@>Wait: 15 frame(s)
@>Move Picture: 1, @20, Upper Left (0,0), (100%,100%), 0, Normal
@>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]When the council asked what we should do with these creatures, it was I who 
 :    : proposed the idea of treating them similarly to Pokémon.
@>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]Given how similar they were to Pokémon, it only made sense.
@>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]As they weren't Pokémon, however, the scientific community decided it was best to
 :    : classify them as something else.
@>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]With their one shared trait being that they resembled tiny humanoids- dolls, to 
 :    : be precise, we collectively agreed to call them Puppets.
@>Move Picture: 1, @20, Upper Left (0,0), (100%,100%), 255, Normal
@>Wait: 20 frame(s)

Options Enabled

Trigger: Autorun

List of Event Commands:
@>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]You'll have to forgive me, my memory's not as sharp as it used to be. Could you remind me of your names again?
@>Text: \xn[Blonde-Haired Girl]Not a problem! My name is Maribel Hearn, and this is my friend, Renko Usami.
@>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]Understood. So, Miss Hearn, let me see if I have this correct...
@>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]You and your friend here are from another world, and you managed to accidentally 
 :    : cross into this one when trying to enter this "Sealed Realm", you called it?
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]Something along those lines!
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]Renko and I have been part of a club at our university that tries to seek out
 :    : unexplainable phenomena, and our biggest project is proving the existance of a 
 :    : realm that exists alongside ours.
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]We finally hit a breakthrough on our research, and we thought we found a way to break through the seal, but...
@>Text: \xn[Renko]It looks like our efforts managed to get us here, instead! Who would have thought
 :    : there'd be another world adjacent to ours!
@>Text: \xn[Renko]After we arrived here, we thought we ended up in the right location at first, but...
@>Text: \xn[Renko]None of my abilities to discern location lined up with any of my notes.
@>Text: \xn[Renko]We set out to try and find civilization, but as we were, we got chased down by that tiny cat-like creature...
@>Text: \xn[Renko]You said it was called a Puppet?
@>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]Exactly, that would be a Puppet of the Chen evolutionary family. They're quite common around these parts.
@>Text: \xn[Renko]Well, it was thanks to that Chen Puppet that we got chased into your backyard.
@>Text: \xn[Renko]After that, well... you know the rest of the story.
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]With how little we were prepared with what we found here, it has me wondering if we 
 :    : would even be prepared for what might happen if we did end up inside the Sealed Realm...
@>Set Move Route: [Renko]
 :              : $>Turn Right
@>Text: \xn[Renko]Aww, Mary, don't be like that! Doesn't the thrill of adventure excite you!
@>Text: \xn[Renko]Who knows, maybe this place will have even more clues about the Sealed Realm!
@>Set Move Route: [Maribel]
 :              : $>Turn Left
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]Renko... You really think we can handle what lies ahead in this world?
@>Text: \xn[Renko]The way I figure it, all we have to do is obtain a Puppet somehow!
@>Text: \xn[Renko]If we become Puppet handlers just like Red is, we should be able to tackle this 
 :    : world and anything it throws our way!
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]Well... I can't deny that you make a good point, Renko!
@>Set Move Route: [Maribel]
 :              : $>Turn Down
@>Set Move Route: [Renko]
 :              : $>Turn Down
@>Text: \xn[Red's Mother]It looks like you both have a plan going forward, which means you'll be seeing Professor Oak again soon!
@>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]Yes, people usually stop by my lab to pick up their first Pokémon or Puppets.
@>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]Though, as of late, I've had such a great demand for Puppets that they're all people want these days...
@>Text: \xn[Renko]What kind of Puppets do you usually give out, Professor Oak?
@>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]I'll let that be a surprise for tomorrow! For tonight, why don't you two get some rest?
@>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]Red's mother and the other residents of Pallet Town helped to prepare a place for
 :    : you two to stay while you're here visiting.
@>Text: \xn[Red's Mother]In the meanwhile, why don't you get to know my son here? I'm sure he can show you 
 :    : the ropes on how to be a trainer.
@>Text: \xn[Red]...
@>Wait: 20 frame(s)
@>Text: \xn[Renko]Did we do something to bother him? He hasn't said a word all night...
@>Text: \xn[Red's Mother]Oh, goodness no! He's always been like this, ever since he was a child.
@>Text: \xn[Red's Mother]Red's not much for words, but he's a kind and caring soul. A mother couldn't ask for a better son!
@>Text: \xn[Red's Mother]Though he doesn't speak much, he's always made up for it with his actions.
@>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]Speaking of his actions. Red, if you'd like, you can keep that Reimu Puppet you used in battle earlier.
@>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]To this day, I've never seen her take to someone quite as fast as she had to you, 
 :    : so I'm sure you two will make a great team.
@>Wait: 10 frame(s)
@>Text: \xn[Red]...
@>Wait: 10 frame(s)
@>Set Move Route: [Red]
 :              : $>Move Right
 :              : $>Move Down
 :              : $>Move Right
 :              : $>Move Right
 :              : $>Move Right
 :              : $>Move Right
 :              : $>Move Up
 :              : $>Move Up
 :              : $>Move Up
 :              : $>Move Right
 :              : $>SE: 'Door exit', 80, 100
 :              : $>Change Opacity: 0
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]Wait, wouldn't it be dangerous out there at night?
@>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]No more dangerous than during the day! The only danger is in being unprepared,
 :    : and Red knows this town like the back of his hand.
@>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]At any rate, I would love to hear more about this Sealed Realm you two were 
 :    : studying. It may prove invaluable to my own research.
@>Script: pbSetSelfSwitch2(13,5,"B",true)
@>Fade Out BGM: 2 sec.
@>Change Screen Color Tone: (-255,-255,-255,0), @6
@>Wait: 20 frame(s)
@>Transfer Player:[013: Cutscene: Lab Back Garden], (029,014), Right, No Fade
@>Change Screen Color Tone: (-35,-35,7,68), @6
@>Play BGM: 'W-012. Ecruteak & Cianwood City', 70, 100
@>

  :       : p.reset_moves
  :       : 
  :       : pbAddPokemon(p)

  @>Script: pbSetSelfSwitch(1,"A",true)
  @>Script: pbSetSelfSwitch(10,"B",true)

   @>Script: pbRegisterPartner(:SCMary,"Maribel",2)
   @>
  : Else
   @>Script: pbRegisterPartner(:SCRenko,"Renko",2)
   @>
  : Branch End
  @>
 : Branch End

  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: Else
 @>Change Text Options: Bottom, Hide

 @>Change Text Options: Bottom, Show
 @>Jump to Label: :wacko:
 @>
: Branch End
@>

  :       : p.item=:ORANBERRY

  :       :

  @>Control Variables: [0007: Starter choice] = 2

 : Branch End

 :              : $>Turn Down

@>Control Switches: [0104: Transition Handler] = ON
@>Control Variables: [0103: Vs. Transition ID] = 0
@>Control Variables: [0115: Vs. Transition - Background] = 0

@>Comment: ==================

@>Control Switches: [0104: Transition Handler] = OFF

@>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]The opposing team's Puppets have fainted! This match's victory goes to...
@>Conditional Branch: Variable [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] == 1

  :              : $>Turn Down

  :              : $>Turn Up

  :              : $>Jump: +0,+0

  :              : $>Jump: +0,+0

 @>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]Now, come over here you three.

  :              : $>Move Right
  :              : $>Move Right
  :              : $>Move Right
  :              : $>Move Up

  :              : $>Move Left
  :              : $>Move Left
  :              : $>Move Left
  :              : $>Move Left
  :              : $>Move Up
 @>Set Move Route: [Maribel]
  :              : $>Move Right
  :              : $>Move Right
  :              : $>Move Right
  :              : $>Move Right
  :              : $>Move Up
  :              : $>Move Up
 @>Wait for Move's Completion
 @>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]I haven't seen a battle like that since Red first left on his journey almost ten years ago!
 @>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]You two are more than ready for what lies ahead.
 @>Text: \xn[Maribel]Thank you Professor Oak! There's no way we could have done it without trusting in each other and our Puppets!
 @>Text: \xn[Maribel]I'm definitely seeing what it means to be a trainer... There's no way words alone could
  :    : have explained it, that battle spoke volumes!

: Else
 @>Comment: --- Red wins

  :              : $>Move Right

  :              : $>Move Left
  :              : $>Move Up

  :              : $>Move Right
  :              : $>Move Right
  :              : $>Move Right
  :              : $>Move Right
  :              : $>Move Up
  :              : $>Move Up
 @>Wait for Move's Completion
 @>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]I haven't seen a battle like that since Red first left on his journey almost ten years ago!
 @>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]You two are more than ready for what lies ahead.
 @>Text: \xn[Maribel]Even though we lost?
 @>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]As I'm sure Red here could tell you, even he's lost a battle here and there!
 @>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]Why, that's the fate of a rainer who seeks out challenges and aims to become stronger!
 @>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]Nobody remains unbeatable forever, afterall!
 @>Text: \xn[Renko]I suppose that is true...
 @>Text: \xn[Renko]Even in mine and Mary's case, if we let ourselves get stalled every time we hit a
  :    : dead end, we'd never get anywhere!
 @>Text: \xn[Renko]In the end, I'd say that battle taught both of us a lot about what it means to be 
  :    : a trainer, and how difficult the road ahead will be.
 @>
: Branch End
@>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]Precisely! And just remmeber, even if you lose, that's still important growth.
@>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]There's always something to be learned, even in defeat, something I'm sure Red can
 :    : tell you from his many years of experience.
@>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]The more you trust in your partners, the more they'll come to trust in you.
@>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]That mutual trust will foster an unbreakable bond, and in turn, you might even become like Red!
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]Red was a very effective teacher! This shall be a lesson that Renko and I will take
 :    : with us as we continue down this road!
@>Text: \xn[Renko]Yeah! Thanks to him, I totally feel like we know what to expect when we walk out those doors!
@>Text: \xn[Red]...
@>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]Haha, now now you two, if you keep this up he'll turn into a stuttering mess!
@>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]Before you two leave though, there's something I want both of you to have.
@>Set Move Route: [Professor Oak]
 :              : $>Move Down
 :              : $>Wait: 10 frame(s)
 :              : $>Move Left
 :              : $>Turn Down
 :              : $>Wait: 10 frame(s)
 :              : $>Move Right
 :              : $>Move Up
 :              : $>Turn Down
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Script: $Trainer.has_pokedex = true
:       : $PokemonBag.pbStoreItem(:POKEBALL,10)
@>Text: Renko and Maribel received a Pokédex and 10 Pokéballs from Professor Oak!\me[Pkmn get]\wtnp[80]
@>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]First off, this is the Pokédex, a creation of my own devising that will automatically
 :    : record data on all the Pokémon and Puppets in the world.
@>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]Speaking of which, Red, I'll be needing your Pokédex to upgrade it later. Yours is using an outdated firmware.
@>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]Aside from that, these are Pokéballs, which can be used to capture any Pokémon or 
 :    : Puppet you see in the wild, and add them to your party.
@>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]They came in all sorts of varieties, but this is the most basic model.
@>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]And with that, you both are now fully qualified to head out into the world and begin your lives as Trainers!
@>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]The world of Monsekai is vast, and waiting to be explored! You'll never know what you'll find out there!
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]And so it's finally begun...
@>Set Move Route: [Maribel]
 :              : $>Turn Left
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]Are you ready for this, Renko?
@>Set Move Route: [Renko]
 :              : $>Turn Right
@>Text: \xn[Renko]Absolutely, Mary! Let's get out there and see what secrets this world has waiting for us to discover!
@>Comment: --------------------
@>Script: $GameSpeed = 0
:       : $frame = 0
:       : pbDisallowSpeedup
@>Change Screen Color Tone: (-255,-255,-255,0), @20
@>Memorize BGM/BGS
@>Fade Out BGM: 1 sec.
@>Wait: 20 frame(s)
@>Script: IntroEnd.new
@>Wait: 20 frame(s)
@>Comment: --------------------
@>Script: pbShowPicture(1,"AltTitle/TitleBG.png",1,256,192,zoomX=100,zoomY=100,opacity=0,blendType=0)
@>Play ME: 'Title Theme', 100, 100
@>Wait: 10 frame(s)
@>Move Picture: 1, @20, Center (256,192), (100%,100%), 255, Normal
@>Script: pbShowPicture(2,"AltTitle/TitleText1.png",1,256,192,zoomX=100,zoomY=100,opacity=0,blendType=0)
@>Script: pbShowPicture(3,"AltTitle/TitleText2.png",1,256,192,zoomX=100,zoomY=100,opacity=0,blendType=0)
@>Wait: 20 frame(s)
@>Move Picture: 2, @40, Center (256,192), (100%,100%), 255, Normal
@>Wait: 80 frame(s)
@>Move Picture: 2, @40, Center (256,192), (100%,100%), 0, Normal
@>Wait: 40 frame(s)
@>Move Picture: 3, @45, Center (256,192), (100%,100%), 255, Normal
@>Wait: 160 frame(s)
@>Move Picture: 3, @40, Center (256,192), (100%,100%), 0, Normal
@>Move Picture: 1, @40, Center (256,192), (100%,100%), 0, Normal
@>Wait: 40 frame(s)
@>Comment: --------------------
@>Change Transparent Flag: Normal
@>Script: pbAllowSpeedup
@>Transfer Player:[034: Pallet Town], (041,014), Left, No Fade

@>Text: Did you know that the way berries grow in Kanto 
 :    : and Johto is different compared to regions like 
 :    : Hoenn?
@>Text: Hoenn's climate and ecology allows for berries to be 
 :    : planted out in the wild by the average trainer and 
 :    : picked at a later date.
@>Text: Kanto and Johto have specific trees that grow in the 
 :    : region that will replenish berries on a near day-to-
 :    : day basis.
@>Text: Of course, these aren't exclusive to their regions! 
 :    : You can still find berry trees in Hoenn, just like you 
 :    : can find fertile soil in Kanto and Johto.
@>Text: It's just that they're less common outside their native 
 :    : regions.
@>Text: Isn't that interesting? Nature sure is fascinating!
@>

  :    : in the hopes of expanding the museum's displays.

#==============================================================================
Map ID: 051
Map Name: Route 5: Daycare
Tileset: 003: Inside
Width: 20, Height: 15
Auto-Change BGM: W-007. Route Theme 2

#------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Event ID: 001
Event Name: Day Care Man
(X,Y): (002,003)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Graphic: NPC 18

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Conditional Branch: Script: Kernel.pbEggGenerated?
 @>Text: \bAh, it's you!
 @>Text: \bWe were raising your Pokémon, and my goodness, 
  :    : were we surprised!
 @>Text: \bYour Pokémon was holding an Egg!
 @>Text: \bWe don't know how it got there, but your Pokémon 
  :    : had it.
 @>Text: \bYou do want it, don't you?
 @>Show Choices: Yes, No
 (When Cancel: Choice 2)
 : When [Yes]
  @>Label: ReceiveEgg
  @>Conditional Branch: Script: $Trainer.party.length>=6
   @>Text: \bYou have no room for it right now...  Come back 
    :    : when you've made room.
   @>Exit Event Processing
   @>
  : Branch End
  @>Text: \PN received the Egg from the Day-Care Man.
  @>Text: \bYou take good care of it.
  @>Script: pbDayCareGenerateEgg
  @>Script: $PokemonGlobal.daycareEgg=0
  :       : $PokemonGlobal.daycareEggSteps=0
  @>
 : When [No]
  @>Text: \bI really will keep it.  You do want this Egg, yes?
  @>Show Choices: Yes, No
  (When Cancel: Choice 2)
  : When [Yes]
   @>Jump to Label: ReceiveEgg
   @>
  : When [No]
   @>Text: \bWell all right then, I'll take it.  Thank you.
   @>Text: \bThat is, I don't think we'll ever find another...
   @>Text: \bNo, no, I'm sure we'll find another one.  I'm definitely 
    :    : sure of it!
   @>Script: $PokemonGlobal.daycareEgg=0
   :       : $PokemonGlobal.daycareEggSteps=0
   @>Exit Event Processing
   @>
  : Branch End
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: Else
 @>Conditional Branch: Script: Kernel.pbDayCareDeposited==0
  @>Text: \bI'm the Day-Care Man.
  @>Text: \bI help take care of the precious Pokémon of 
   :    : trainers.
  @>Text: \bAny Pokémon you'd like to have raised you can 
   :    : leave in my wife's care.
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>Conditional Branch: Script: Kernel.pbDayCareDeposited==1
  @>Script: pbDayCareGetDeposited(-1,3,-1)

Event ID: 001
Event Name: EV001
(X,Y): (014,015)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Graphic: trainer_PAINTER

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Set Move Route: This event
 :              : $>Turn Up
@>Text: I wonder which challenge I should take...
@>Set Move Route: This event
 :              : $>Turn toward Player
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Text: Oh? Do you know about the two types of challenges 
 :    : the Pokémon League offers?
@>Show Choices: Yes, No
(When Cancel: Disallow)
: When [Yes]
 @>Text: Yeah, the Pokémon League has become flexible 
  :    : over the years. It's kinda nice.
 @>
: When [No]
 @>Text: Well, there's two paths you can take.
 @>Text: The first path is the classic Badge Check path. 
  :    : Trainers have to go across the region and collect the badges.
 @>Text: Once they get a minimum of eight badges from that region, 
  :    : they return here and are granted access into Route 23's 
  :    : Underground, which leads to Victory Road.
 @>Text: Then there's the new path, which allows you to 
  :    : challenge the Pokémon League whenever you want,
  :    : no badges required!
 @>Text: The only thing is, you have to challenge a series of 
  :    : trainers on Route 23, all representing the official 
  :    : gyms in Kanto.
 @>Text: After you beat them, you get to enter the last portion of 
  :    : Victory Road, and it's just a straight path from there to 
  :    : the front doors of the Indigo Plateau!
 @>Text: The Pokémon League really has become versatile 
  :    : over the past few years!
 @>
: Branch End
@>

 :              : $>Move Up

                  (Ignore If Can't Move)
 :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
 :              : $>Turn Right
 :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
 :              : $>Turn Left
 :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
 :              : $>Turn Down
 :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)

  :              : $>Turn Right
  :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
  :              : $>Turn Left
  :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
  :              : $>Turn Down
  :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)

 @>
: Branch End
@>Script: setTempSwitchOn("A")

Autonomous Movement

Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Text: Good day to you, welcome to Pokémon Tower. Is there something
 :    : I can help you with today?
@>Wait: 20 frame(s)
@>Text: Oh! You're here for research and would like to speak to one of
 :    : the Elder Priestesses? Just one moment!
@>Set Move Route: This event
 :              : $>Turn Right
@>Play SE: 'PC access', 80, 100
@>Text: Hello, sorry to disturb you right now ma'am, but there's someone
 :    : here for-...\wt[30] -No, they aren't with the League.
@>Text: They said they came here to do some research, and would like to
 :    : speak to one of the Elder Priestesses.
@>Wait: 30 frame(s)
@>Text: Oh, you will? Alright, I'll let them know you'll be right up!
@>Set Move Route: This event
 :              : $>Turn Down
@>Play SE: 'PC close', 80, 100
@>Text: You're in luck! The Head Priestess herself will be right up to answer
 :    : whatever questions you may have.
@>Text: Just wait here and she'll be along before too long.

@>Set Event Location: [Head Priestess],(003,010), Right
@>Set Move Route: [Priestess]
 :              : $>Turn Left
 :              : $>Wait: 20 frame(s)
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Set Move Route: [Priestess]
 :              : $>Through ON
 :              : $>Move Up
 :              : $>Turn Down
@>Set Move Route: [Head Priestess]
 :              : $>Wait: 15 frame(s)
 :              : $>Through ON
 :              : $>Move Right
 :              : $>Move Right
 :              : $>Through OFF
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Set Move Route: [Priestess]
 :              : $>Move Down
 :              : $>Turn Right
 :              : $>Through OFF
@>Set Move Route: [Head Priestess]
 :              : $>Move Down
 :              : $>Move Down
 :              : $>Move Down
 :              : $>Move Down
 :              : $>Move Right
 :              : $>Move Right
 :              : $>Move Right
 :              : $>Move Right
 :              : $>Move Right
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Text: \xn[Head Priestess]Hello there, I'm the Head Priestess of Pokémon
 :    : Tower.
@>Set Move Route: Player
 :              : $>Turn Left
@>Text: \xn[Head Priestess]I heard you're here to do research, and wished
 :    : to speak to someone. What information is it you would like to know
 :    : about?
@>Wait: 10 frame(s)
@>Show Animation: [Head Priestess], [Exclaim bubble]
@>Set Move Route: [Head Priestess]
 :              : $>Direction Fix ON
 :              : $>Change Speed: 5
 :              : $>1 Step Backward
@>Text: \xn[Head Priestess]My word, did you just say the "Sealed Realm"!?
@>Wait: 10 frame(s)
@>Set Move Route: [Head Priestess]
 :              : $>Change Speed: 3
 :              : $>Direction Fix OFF
 :              : $>Move Right
@>Text: \xn[Head Priestess]I'm... surprised! There's... not many people
 :    : these days who are aware of the existence of what you're
 :    : asking about.
@>Text: \xn[Head Priestess]Might I ask your name, miss?
@>Wait: 15 frame(s)
@>Conditional Branch: Variable [0107: Chosen Protag] == 0
 @>Comment: --- Renko
 @>Show Animation: [Head Priestess], [Exclaim bubble]
 @>Text: \xn[Head Priestess]I-I'm sorry!? Did you just say your name 
  :    : was \pn!?
 @>Text: \xn[Head Priestess]N-No, it must just be a coincidence...
 @>
: Else
 @>Comment: --- Maribel
 @>Text: \xn[Head Priestess]\pn, hmm? Odd, that name sounds
  :    : familiar...
 @>Text: \xn[Head Priestess]We haven't met before, right?
 @>
: Branch End
@>Text: \xn[Head Priestess]Well, anyway... You wanted to know about
 :    : the "Sealed Realm", correct...?
@>Text: \xn[Head Priestess]I believe we should have some information
 :    : about it in our archives... If you'll please follow me down to
 :    : the basement.
@>Set Move Route: [Head Priestess]
 :              : $>Move Left
 :              : $>Move Left
 :              : $>Move Left
 :              : $>Move Left
 :              : $>Move Up
 :              : $>Move Up
 :              : $>Move Up
 :              : $>Move Up
 :              : $>Turn Left
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Wait: 20 frame(s)
@>Set Move Route: [Priestess]
 :              : $>Through ON
 :              : $>Move Up
 :              : $>Turn Down
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Set Move Route: [Head Priestess]
 :              : $>Through ON
 :              : $>Move Left
 :              : $>Move Left
 :              : $>Move Left
 :              : $>Move Left
 :              : $>Through OFF
 :              : $>SE: 'Door exit', 80, 100
 :              : $>Change Opacity: 0
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Set Move Route: [Priestess]
 :              : $>Move Down
 :              : $>Turn Right
 :              : $>Through OFF
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Script: advanceQuestToStage(:Quest21, 2)
@>Script: pbSetSelfSwitch(2,"A",true)
@>Control Self Switch: B =ON
@>

 :    : time here?
@>Show Choices: Yes, No
(When Cancel: Choice 2)
: When [Yes]
 @>Text: The Trainer Academy used to be the Viridian City 
  :    : Trainer House. People would come here daily to 
  :    : battle various trainers.
 @>Text: Eventually, we expanded the Trainer House to serve 
  :    : as both a school and a place to apply said 
  :    : knowledge. 
 @>Text: We have the most up-to-date resources, as well as 
  :    : some books documenting things prior to the Puppet 
  :    : Invasion eight years back.
 @>Text: The upstairs portion of the Academy is where the 
  :    : classroom and bookshelves are.
 @>Text: The downstairs portion is where trainers can battle 
  :    : instructors approved by the facility. They don't give 
  :    : out money or EXP after the battle, though.
 @>Text: That is everything there is to know about the Trainer 
  :    : Academy!
 @>
: When [No]
 @>Text: Please enjoy your stay then!
 @>Exit Event Processing
 @>
: Branch End
@>Text: Please enjoy your stay!
@>

  :    : Special Defense, and HP.
 @>
: Branch End
@>Conditional Branch: Variable [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] == 1

  :    : Attack Puppet. It usually prioritizes Attack and Special 
  :    : Attack.
 @>
: Branch End
@>Conditional Branch: Variable [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] == 2
 @>Text: The Swift Shard, which evolves a puppet into a 
  :    : Speed Puppet. This usually prioritizes Speed.
 @>
: Branch End
@>Conditional Branch: Variable [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] == 3
 @>Text: The Tech Shard, which evolves puppets into 
  :    : Technical Puppets. This can do a wide variety of 
  :    : things and makes a puppet more versatile.
 @>
: Branch End
@>Conditional Branch: Variable [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] == 4
 @>Text: The Support Shard, which evolves puppets into a 
  :    : Helper Puppet. This can vary widely, but it usually 
  :    : focuses on helping out the rest of the team.
 @>
: Branch End
@>Conditional Branch: Variable [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] == 5
 @>Text: The Solar Shard, which evolves puppets into an 
  :    : Advent Puppet. Very few things evolve from this, 
  :    : and their abilities widely vary.
 @>
: Branch End
@>Text: For more information about what puppets evolve with 
 :    : which stone, please consult the document "Stone 
 :    : Evolutions" provided in the folder.
@>

 :    : Trainer Academy.

 :    : raise your Pokemon or Puppet's strength.

 :    : what they do is help raise a Pokemon in a specific 
 :    : stat.

 :    : Defense, and Speed.

 :    : advanced courses, please talk to the receptionist 
 :    : next to me.

 @>Text: \xn[Maribel]This place had some interesting reads, but nothing too relevant to our interests.
 @>Text: \xn[Maribel]It did provide a fair bit of information about how Puppets work, though!
 @>Text: \xn[Maribel]I could use a bit of a break though...

 @>

@>Conditional Branch: Variable [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] == 0
 @>Comment: --- Yes
 @>Text: \xn[Maribel]Alright! Let's go, Renko!
 @>Comment: ==================
 @>Control Switches: [0104: Transition Handler] = ON
 @>Control Variables: [0103: Vs. Transition ID] = 2
 @>Control Variables: [0104: Vs. Transition - Pkmn] = 2
 @>Control Variables: [0115: Vs. Transition - Background] = 3

  @>
 : Else
  @>Exit Event Processing
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>Comment: ==================
 @>Script: pbTrainerEnd
 @>Control Switches: [0104: Transition Handler] = OFF
 @>Text: \xn[Maribel]That was a good battle, Renko! I see we've both managed to improve since we left Pallet Town!
 @>Text: \xn[Maribel]I should probably head on out and get some more training done.
 @>Text: \xn[Maribel]Oh, I did hear one thing though.
 @>Text: \xn[Maribel]Apparently there's some an exhibit in Pewter City, just north of here, where
  :    : they're showcasing rare artifacts.
 @>Text: \xn[Maribel]Apparently they've come from the moon! I wonder if it's related to that civilization I saw on the Moon...
 @>Text: \xn[Maribel]Oh, uh- pay me no mind! Just talking to myself!
 @>Text: \xn[Maribel]You should head over there and see if maybe you can find anything interesting!
 @>Text: \xn[Maribel]I'll linger around Viridian a bit longer before I head out again.
 @>Text: \xn[Maribel]Catch you later, Renko!

#------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Event ID: 002
Event Name: Nurse
(X,Y): (007,002)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Graphic: NPC 16

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Comment: This line of code sets the player's current position as 
 :       : the spot they will return to after they lose a battle 
 :       : and lack out.
 :       : Page 2 of this event detects when this happens, and 
 :       : heals the player's Pokémon and wishes them better 
 :       : luck in future.
@>Script: pbSetPokemonCenter
@>Text: \rHello, and welcome to the Pokémon Center.
@>Text: \rWe restore your tired Pokémon to full health.
@>Text: \rWould you like to rest your Pokémon?
@>Show Choices: Yes, No
(When Cancel: Choice 2)
: When [Yes]
 @>Text: \rOK, I'll take your Pokémon for a few seconds.
 @>Recover All: Entire Party
 @>Set Move Route: This event
  :              : $>Turn Left
  :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
 @>Wait for Move's Completion
 @>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
 @>Script: count = $Trainer.pokemon_count
 :       : for i in 1..count
 :       :   pbSet(6, i)
 :       :   pbSEPlay("Battle ball shake")
 :       :   pbWait(16)
 :       : end
 @>Set Move Route: [Healing balls]
  :              : $>Stop Animation ON
 @>Play ME: 'Pkmn healing', 100, 100
 @>Wait: 58 frame(s)
 @>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
 @>Script: get_character(4).pattern = 0
 @>Set Move Route: [Healing balls]
  :              : $>Stop Animation OFF
 @>Set Move Route: This event
  :              : $>Wait: 15 frame(s)
  :              : $>Turn Down
 @>Wait for Move's Completion
 @>Conditional Branch: Script: pbPokerus?
  @>Text: \rYour Pokémon may be infected by PokeRus.
  @>Text: \rLittle is known about the PokeRus except that they 
   :    : are microscopic life-forms that attach to Pokémon.
  @>Text: \rWhile infected, Pokémon are said to grow 
   :    : exceptionally well.
  @>Control Switches: [0002: Seen Pokérus in Poké Center] = ON
  @>
 : Else
  @>Text: \rThank you for waiting.
  @>Text: \rWe've restored your Pokémon to full health.
  @>Set Move Route: This event
   :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 1
   :              : $>Wait: 10 frame(s)
   :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 0
  @>Wait for Move's Completion
  @>Text: \rWe hope to see you again!
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: When [No]
 @>Text: \rWe hope to see you again!
 @>
: Branch End
@>

Page #2
Conditions
Switch 0001: Starting over is ON

Graphic: NPC 16

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Autorun

List of Event Commands:
@>Comment: Every map you can end up in after having all your 
 :       : Pokémon faint (typically Poké Centers and home) 
 :       : must have an Autorun event in it like this one.
 :       : This event fully heals all the player's Pokémon, says 
 :       : something to that effect, and turns the "Starting 
 :       : over" switch OFF again.
@>Comment: For convenience, this can be a single page in an 
 :       : NPC's event (e.g. Mom, a nurse).
@>Text: \rFirst, you should restore your Pokémon to full 
 :    : health.
@>Recover All: Entire Party
@>Set Move Route: This event
 :              : $>Turn Left
 :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
@>Script: for i in 1..$Trainer.pokemon_count
:       :   pbSet(6, i)
:       :   pbSEPlay("Battle ball shake")
:       :   pbWait(16)
:       : end
@>Set Move Route: [Healing balls]
 :              : $>Stop Animation ON
@>Play ME: 'Pkmn healing', 100, 100
@>Wait: 58 frame(s)
@>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
@>Script: get_character(4).pattern = 0
@>Set Move Route: [Healing balls]
 :              : $>Stop Animation OFF
@>Set Move Route: This event
 :              : $>Wait: 15 frame(s)
 :              : $>Turn Down
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Text: \rYour Pokémon have been healed to perfect health.
@>Set Move Route: This event
 :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 1
 :              : $>Wait: 10 frame(s)
 :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 0
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Text: \rWe hope you excel!
@>Control Switches: [0001: Starting over] = OFF
@>

None

Autonomous Movement

Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled

List of Event Commands:

 :    : Terminal?
@>Show Choices: Yes, No
(When Cancel: Choice 2)
: When [Yes]
 @>Text: Please be advised, our servers were recently 
  :    : hacked, and we are not back to optimal standards.
 @>Text: As a result, an influx of illegally leveled Pokemon and 
  :    : Puppets are making their way through the servers.
 @>Text: Do you still wish to use the Trade system?
 @>Show Choices: Yes, No
 (When Cancel: Choice 2)
 : When [Yes]
  @>Text: Initalizing trade system, please stand by\..\..\..
   :    : \wtnp[20]\se[computeropen]
  @>Script: pbWonderTrade(1,[],
  :       : [:ARTICUNO,:ZAPDOS,:MOLTRES,:MEWTWO,:MEW,:RAIKOU,:ENTEI,:SUICUNE,:LUGIA,:HOOH,:CELEBI,:REGIROCK,:REGICE,

 :    : was a Reisen. She looks like she'd be a Reason type 
 :    : but she's actually a Heart type.

 :    : maybe I'll look into that!
@>

 :    : work around the clock to connect the regions of the 
 :    : world!

 :    : Johto's Goldenrod City, another in Hoenn's Mauville 
 :    : City, and the last one in Sinnoh's Jubilife City.
@>Text: From these hubs we allow trainers to trade Pokemon 
 :    : and Puppets with other trainers across the world!
@>Text: Just go up to one of the machines and you're good to 
 :    : go!
@>Text: If you would like to withdraw or deposit something, 
 :    : please use the PC beside me.
@>Text: We hope you enjoy using the Global Uplink Terminal!

    :              : $>Direction Fix ON
    :              : $>SE: 'faint', 80, 100

@>Conditional Branch: Script: get_character(0).onEvent?
 @>Set Move Route: Player
                   (Ignore If Can't Move)
  :              : $>Move Down
 @>Wait for Move's Completion
 @>
: Branch End
@>Script: setTempSwitchOn("A")
@>

(When Cancel: Choice 2)
: When [Yes]
 @>Change Screen Color Tone: (-255,-255,-255,0), @20
 @>Wait: 8 frame(s)
 @>Play ME: 'Pokemon Healing', 100, 100
 @>Wait: 20 frame(s)
 @>Change Screen Color Tone: (0,0,0,0), @20
 @>Recover All: Entire Party
 @>Text: Your party was healed.
 @>
: When [No]
 @>
: Branch End
@>

 :    : heard the stories, those born within the forest are blessed with
 :    : the power of the forest. This ability allows me to telekenetically
 :    : communicate with Pokemon or Puppets.
@>Text: My ability as a trainer is dwarfed by the emotional bond I 
 :    : share with my Pokemon and Puppets! I may not be the
 :    : strongest trainer around, but after Green taught me the
 :    : methods of battling, I can hold my own against most challengers.
@>Text: If you wish to make it to the Pokemon League, the last stop is

   :    : battle it was.

   :    : clearly more well trained than mine were, both physically

Event ID: 031
Event Name: Vending machine 1
(X,Y): (031,057)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Conditional Branch: Player is facing Up
 @>Label: Start
 @>Text: It's a vending machine.\n
  :    : Which drink would you like?\G
 @>Show Choices: Fresh Water - $200, Soda Pop - $300, Lemonade - $350, Cancel
 (When Cancel: Choice 4)
 : When [Fresh Water - $200]
  @>Conditional Branch: Gold 200 or more
   @>Conditional Branch: Script: $PokemonBag.pbCanStore?(PBItems::FRESHWATER)
    @>Change Gold: - 200
    @>Script: $PokemonBag.pbStoreItem(PBItems::FRESHWATER)
    @>Text: \GA Fresh Water dropped down!
    @>Control Variables: [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] = Random No. (0...10)
    @>Conditional Branch: Variable [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] == 0
     @>Conditional Branch: Script: $PokemonBag.pbCanStore?(PBItems::FRESHWATER)
      @>Script: $PokemonBag.pbStoreItem(PBItems::FRESHWATER)
      @>Text: \GBonus! Another Fresh Water dropped down.
      @>
     : Branch End
     @>
    : Branch End
    @>Jump to Label: Start
    @>
   : Else
    @>Text: \GYou have no room left in the Bag.
    @>
   : Branch End
   @>
  : Else
   @>Text: \GYou don't have enough money.
   @>
  : Branch End
  @>
 : When [Soda Pop - $300]
  @>Conditional Branch: Gold 300 or more
   @>Conditional Branch: Script: $PokemonBag.pbCanStore?(PBItems::SODAPOP)
    @>Change Gold: - 300
    @>Script: $PokemonBag.pbStoreItem(PBItems::SODAPOP)
    @>Text: \GA Soda Pop dropped down!
    @>Control Variables: [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] = Random No. (0...10)
    @>Conditional Branch: Variable [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] == 0
     @>Conditional Branch: Script: $PokemonBag.pbCanStore?(PBItems::SODAPOP)
      @>Script: $PokemonBag.pbStoreItem(PBItems::SODAPOP)
      @>Text: \GBonus! Another Soda Pop dropped down.
      @>
     : Branch End
     @>
    : Branch End
    @>Jump to Label: Start
    @>
   : Else
    @>Text: \GYou have no room left in the Bag.
    @>
   : Branch End
   @>
  : Else
   @>Text: \GYou don't have enough money.
   @>
  : Branch End
  @>
 : When [Lemonade - $350]
  @>Conditional Branch: Gold 350 or more
   @>Conditional Branch: Script: $PokemonBag.pbCanStore?(PBItems::LEMONADE)
    @>Change Gold: - 350
    @>Script: $PokemonBag.pbStoreItem(PBItems::LEMONADE)
    @>Text: \GA Lemonade dropped down!
    @>Control Variables: [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] = Random No. (0...10)
    @>Conditional Branch: Variable [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] == 0
     @>Conditional Branch: Script: $PokemonBag.pbCanStore?(PBItems::LEMONADE)
      @>Script: $PokemonBag.pbStoreItem(PBItems::LEMONADE)
      @>Text: \GBonus! Another Lemonade dropped down.
      @>
     : Branch End
     @>
    : Branch End
    @>Jump to Label: Start
    @>
   : Else
    @>Text: \GYou have no room left in the Bag.
    @>
   : Branch End
   @>
  : Else
   @>Text: \GYou don't have enough money.
   @>
  : Branch End
  @>
 : When [Cancel]
  @>Text: \GDecided not to buy a drink.
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: Else
 @>
: Branch End
@>

Event ID: 002
Event Name: Nurse
(X,Y): (007,002)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Graphic: NPC 16

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Script: Kernel.pbSetPokemonCenter
@>Text: \rHello, and welcome to the Pokémon Center.
@>Text: \rWe restore your tired partners to full health.
@>Text: \rWould you like to rest your team?
@>Show Choices: Yes, No
(When Cancel: Choice 2)
: When [Yes]
 @>Text: \rOK, I'll take your party for a few seconds.
 @>Recover All: Entire Party
 @>Set Move Route: This event
  :              : $>Turn Left
  :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
 @>Wait for Move's Completion
 @>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
 @>Script: count=$Trainer.pokemonCount
 :       : for i in 1..count
 :       :   pbSet(6,i)
 :       :   pbSEPlay("ballshake")
 :       :   pbWait(16)
 :       : end
 @>Set Move Route: []
  :              : $>Stop Animation ON
 @>Play ME: 'Pokemon Healing', 100, 100
 @>Wait: 58 frame(s)
 @>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
 @>Set Move Route: []
  :              : $>Stop Animation OFF
 @>Set Move Route: This event
  :              : $>Wait: 15 frame(s)
  :              : $>Turn Down
 @>Wait for Move's Completion
 @>Conditional Branch: Script: Kernel.pbPokerus?
  @>Text: \rYour party may have been infected by PokeRus.
  @>Text: \rLittle is known about the PokeRus except that they 
   :    : are microscopic life-forms that attach to Pokémon
   :    : and Puppets.
  @>Text: \rThose that are infeted with it are said to grow 
   :    : exceptionally well.
  @>Control Switches: [0002: Seen Pokérus in Poké Center] = ON
  @>
 : Else
  @>Text: \rThank you for waiting.
  @>Text: \rWe've restored your party to full health.
  @>Set Move Route: This event
   :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 1
   :              : $>Wait: 10 frame(s)
   :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 0
  @>Wait for Move's Completion
  @>Text: \rWe hope to see you again!
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: When [No]
 @>Text: \rWe hope to see you again!
 @>
: Branch End
@>

Conditions

Graphic: NPC 16

Autonomous Movement

Freq: 3: Low

 :    : health.

:       :   pbWait(16)

 :              : $>Stop Animation ON

#------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Event ID: 002
Event Name: Nurse
(X,Y): (007,002)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Graphic: NPC 16

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Comment: This line of code sets the player's current position as 
 :       : the spot they will return to after they lose a battle 
 :       : and lack out.
 :       : Page 2 of this event detects when this happens, and 
 :       : heals the player's Pokémon and wishes them better 
 :       : luck in future.
@>Script: pbSetPokemonCenter
@>Text: \rHello, and welcome to the Pokémon Center.
@>Text: \rWe restore your tired Pokémon to full health.
@>Text: \rWould you like to rest your Pokémon?
@>Show Choices: Yes, No
(When Cancel: Choice 2)
: When [Yes]
 @>Text: \rOK, I'll take your Pokémon for a few seconds.
 @>Recover All: Entire Party
 @>Set Move Route: This event
  :              : $>Turn Left
  :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
 @>Wait for Move's Completion
 @>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
 @>Script: count = $Trainer.pokemon_count
 :       : for i in 1..count
 :       :   pbSet(6, i)
 :       :   pbSEPlay("Battle ball shake")
 :       :   pbWait(16)
 :       : end
 @>Set Move Route: [Healing balls]
  :              : $>Stop Animation ON
 @>Play ME: 'Pkmn healing', 100, 100
 @>Wait: 58 frame(s)
 @>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
 @>Script: get_character(4).pattern = 0
 @>Set Move Route: [Healing balls]
  :              : $>Stop Animation OFF
 @>Set Move Route: This event
  :              : $>Wait: 15 frame(s)
  :              : $>Turn Down
 @>Wait for Move's Completion
 @>Conditional Branch: Script: pbPokerus?
  @>Text: \rYour Pokémon may be infected by PokeRus.
  @>Text: \rLittle is known about the PokeRus except that they 
   :    : are microscopic life-forms that attach to Pokémon.
  @>Text: \rWhile infected, Pokémon are said to grow 
   :    : exceptionally well.
  @>Control Switches: [0002: Seen Pokérus in Poké Center] = ON
  @>
 : Else
  @>Text: \rThank you for waiting.
  @>Text: \rWe've restored your Pokémon to full health.
  @>Set Move Route: This event
   :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 1
   :              : $>Wait: 10 frame(s)
   :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 0
  @>Wait for Move's Completion
  @>Text: \rWe hope to see you again!
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: When [No]
 @>Text: \rWe hope to see you again!
 @>
: Branch End
@>

Page #2
Conditions
Switch 0001: Starting over is ON

Graphic: NPC 16

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Autorun

List of Event Commands:
@>Comment: Every map you can end up in after having all your 
 :       : Pokémon faint (typically Poké Centers and home) 
 :       : must have an Autorun event in it like this one.
 :       : This event fully heals all the player's Pokémon, says 
 :       : something to that effect, and turns the "Starting 
 :       : over" switch OFF again.
@>Comment: For convenience, this can be a single page in an 
 :       : NPC's event (e.g. Mom, a nurse).
@>Text: \rFirst, you should restore your Pokémon to full 
 :    : health.
@>Recover All: Entire Party
@>Set Move Route: This event
 :              : $>Turn Left
 :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
@>Script: for i in 1..$Trainer.pokemon_count
:       :   pbSet(6, i)
:       :   pbSEPlay("Battle ball shake")
:       :   pbWait(16)
:       : end
@>Set Move Route: [Healing balls]
 :              : $>Stop Animation ON
@>Play ME: 'Pkmn healing', 100, 100
@>Wait: 58 frame(s)
@>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
@>Script: get_character(4).pattern = 0
@>Set Move Route: [Healing balls]
 :              : $>Stop Animation OFF
@>Set Move Route: This event
 :              : $>Wait: 15 frame(s)
 :              : $>Turn Down
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Text: \rYour Pokémon have been healed to perfect health.
@>Set Move Route: This event
 :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 1
 :              : $>Wait: 10 frame(s)
 :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 0
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Text: \rWe hope you excel!
@>Control Switches: [0001: Starting over] = OFF
@>

Event ID: 002
Event Name: Gym Terminal
(X,Y): (017,037)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Graphic: gymtelecom

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Conditional Branch: Player is facing Right
 @>Text: Accessing Gym Network.
 @>Label: Start
 @>Text: Please select what you want to know about.
 @>Show Choices: Gym Leader Preference, Gym Mechanics, Gym Leader Information, Nothing
 (When Cancel: Choice 4)
 : When [Gym Leader Preference]
  @>Text: The Pewter City Gym, Brock, has a preference for
   :    : Rock-type Pokémon and Earth-type Puppets.
  @>Text: Aside from the traditional weaknesses of Rock-type
   :    : Pokémon, Earth-type Puppets are weak to Hydro, Nature,
   :    : and Cryo-Typed moves.
  @>Text: Earth-Type Puppets resist damage from Miasma, Pyro,
   :    : Poison, and Rock-type moves, and are immune to
   :    : Wind and Electric-type moves.
  @>Jump to Label: Start
  @>
 : When [Gym Mechanics]
  @>Text: Brock has opted to keep him gym simple for the sake
   :    : of beginning chalengers to the Gym Challenge.
  @>Text: Despite constant criticisms that his Gym doesn't stand
   :    : out when compared to other gyms, Brock has remained
   :    : resolute in his decision.
  @>Jump to Label: Start
  @>
 : When [Gym Leader Information]
  @>Text: Aside from being a Gym Leader, Brock is a well
   :    : respected Pokémon Breeder, known across the
   :    : world.
  @>Text: As Brock is often called away for Breeder-related reasons,
   :    : the curator of Pewter Musuem, Miles, will take over as 
   :    : Brock's replacement Gym Leader.
  @>Jump to Label: Start
  @>
 : When [Nothing]
  @>Text: Shutting down information database.
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: Else
 @>
: Branch End
@>

Event ID: 005
Event Name: Brock
(X,Y): (015,005)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Graphic: trainer_LEADER_Brock

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Text: \xn[Brock]Welcome to Pewter Gym! my name is Brock, the Gym Leader. I specialize in Rock-type Pokémon and Earth-type Puppets.
@>Text: \xn[Brock]When it comes to battling, I believe that the best offense is a good defense. You'll find it extremely difficult to break past my defenses!
@>Text: \xn[Brock]Think you have what it takes? Then come on, show me your best!
@>Control Switches: [0104: Transition Handler] = ON
@>Control Variables: [0103: Vs. Transition ID] = 3
@>Call Common Event: Vs. Transition - Badge to Ball Check
@>Control Variables: [0113: Vs. Transition - Badge] = 0
@>Control Variables: [0114: Vs. Transition - Leader] = 0
@>Conditional Branch: Script: pbTrainerBattle(:LEADER_Brock,"Brock",_I("You're stronger than I expected. Impressive work, challenger!"),false,1+$Trainer.badge_count)
 @>Text: \xn[Brock]Not bad at all, challenger! I applaud your skills! As proof of your victory, I confer upon you the Boulder Badge!
 @>Text: \me[Badge get]You earned the Boulder Badge!\wtnp[90]
 @>Script: $Trainer.badges[0]=true # Boulder Badge
 @>Text: \xn[Brock]Having the Boulder Badge will allow your Pokémon or Puppets to use the move Flash outside of battle.
 @>Text: \xn[Brock]Flash is a skill that Pokémon and Puppets can learn that will illuminate dark
  :    : areas, such as caves.
 @>Text: \xn[Brock]Speaking of TMs and SCs, here, take these as well!
 @>Script: pbReceiveItem(:TM39) # Rock Tomb, Pokemon
 :       : pbReceiveItem(:SC39) # Rock Tomb, Puppet
 @>Conditional Branch: Switch [0108: TM/SC Explanation] == OFF
  @>Text: \xn[Brock]What I just gave you is a Technical Machine and a Skill Card, which allow you to teach moves to your Pokémon and Puppets.
  @>Text: \xn[Brock]There are also special Field Move variants called Hidden Machines and Hidden Skill Cards.
  @>Text: \xn[Brock]All of these have an unlimited number of uses, so you can teach them to any number of your Pokémon or Puppets!
  @>Control Switches: [0108: TM/SC Explanation] = ON
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>Text: \xn[Brock]Those are the Rock Tomb TMs and SCs. A rather simple move that'll make rocks fall down on your target, with a chance of lowering their speed as it 
  :    : traps them.
 @>Text: \xn[Brock]Be sure to put them to good use, they'll definitely help give you an advantage in battle!
 @>Control Switches: [0004: Defeated Gym 1] = ON
 @>Script: pbSetSelfSwitch(19,"A",true)
 @>Script: pbSetSelfSwitch(21,"A",true)
 @>
: Branch End
@>Control Switches: [0104: Transition Handler] = OFF
@>

Graphic: Gold (PurpleZaffre)

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Autorun

List of Event Commands:
@>Set Move Route: [Gold]
 :              : $>Move Down
 :              : $>Move Down
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Show Animation: [Gold], [Exclaim bubble]
@>Set Move Route: [Gold]
 :              : $>Wait: 15 frame(s)
 :              : $>Move Down
 :              : $>Move Down
 :              : $>Move Down
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Call Common Event: Vs. Gold - Encounter
@>Text: \xn[Gold]Alright, let's do this, \pn!
@>Control Switches: [0104: Transition Handler] = ON
@>Control Variables: [0103: Vs. Transition ID] = 4
@>Control Variables: [0115: Vs. Transition - Background] = 4
@>Script: setBattleRule("base", "indoor1")
@>Conditional Branch: Script: pbTrainerBattle(:RIVAL_Gold,"Gold",_I(pbGet(4)),false,1+pbGet(116))
 @>Call Common Event: Vs. Gold - Post-Battle
 @>Set Move Route: Player
  :              : $>Move Left

@>Wait: 5 frame(s)
@>Conditional Branch: Script: pbWildBattle(PBSpecies::YORIHIME,52,1,false)
 @>
: Else
 @>
: Branch End
@>

#------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Event ID: 022
Event Name: EV022
(X,Y): (024,036)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Comment: Here's the idea. The Shiny Yorihime fight will utilize Scripted Battles
 :       : to create a battle where Yorihime will swap out with Reisen/Rei'sen
 :       : Puppets randomly at the end of evey turn.
@>Comment: Depending on what is or isn't possible, the Reisen and Rei'sen
 :       : Puppets will become the new active battlers. The player has to
 :       : defeat them before Yorihime comes back onto the field.
@>Comment: If that isn't possible, then the Puppets will attack the player at the
 :       : end of the turn, and Yorihime will come back to the battle before
 :       : the start of the next turn.
@>

 @>
