#------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Event ID: 002
Event Name: Nurse
(X,Y): (007,002)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Graphic: NPC 16

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Comment: This line of code sets the player's current position as 
 :       : the spot they will return to after they lose a battle 
 :       : and lack out.
 :       : Page 2 of this event detects when this happens, and 
 :       : heals the player's Pokémon and wishes them better 
 :       : luck in future.
@>Script: pbSetPokemonCenter
@>Text: \rHello, and welcome to the Pokémon Center.
@>Text: \rWe restore your tired Pokémon to full health.
@>Text: \rWould you like to rest your Pokémon?
@>Show Choices: Yes, No
(When Cancel: Choice 2)
: When [Yes]
 @>Text: \rOK, I'll take your Pokémon for a few seconds.
 @>Recover All: Entire Party
 @>Set Move Route: This event
  :              : $>Turn Left
  :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
 @>Wait for Move's Completion
 @>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
 @>Script: count = $Trainer.pokemon_count
 :       : for i in 1..count
 :       :   pbSet(6, i)
 :       :   pbSEPlay("Battle ball shake")
 :       :   pbWait(16)
 :       : end
 @>Set Move Route: [Healing balls]
  :              : $>Stop Animation ON
 @>Play ME: 'Pkmn healing', 100, 100
 @>Wait: 58 frame(s)
 @>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
 @>Script: get_character(4).pattern = 0
 @>Set Move Route: [Healing balls]
  :              : $>Stop Animation OFF
 @>Set Move Route: This event
  :              : $>Wait: 15 frame(s)
  :              : $>Turn Down
 @>Wait for Move's Completion
 @>Conditional Branch: Script: pbPokerus?
  @>Text: \rYour Pokémon may be infected by PokeRus.
  @>Text: \rLittle is known about the PokeRus except that they 
   :    : are microscopic life-forms that attach to Pokémon.
  @>Text: \rWhile infected, Pokémon are said to grow 
   :    : exceptionally well.
  @>Control Switches: [0002: Seen Pokérus in Poké Center] = ON
  @>
 : Else
  @>Text: \rThank you for waiting.
  @>Text: \rWe've restored your Pokémon to full health.
  @>Set Move Route: This event
   :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 1
   :              : $>Wait: 10 frame(s)
   :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 0
  @>Wait for Move's Completion
  @>Text: \rWe hope to see you again!
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: When [No]
 @>Text: \rWe hope to see you again!
 @>
: Branch End
@>

Page #2
Conditions
Switch 0001: Starting over is ON

Graphic: NPC 16

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Autorun

List of Event Commands:
@>Comment: Every map you can end up in after having all your 
 :       : Pokémon faint (typically Poké Centers and home) 
 :       : must have an Autorun event in it like this one.
 :       : This event fully heals all the player's Pokémon, says 
 :       : something to that effect, and turns the "Starting 
 :       : over" switch OFF again.
@>Comment: For convenience, this can be a single page in an 
 :       : NPC's event (e.g. Mom, a nurse).
@>Text: \rFirst, you should restore your Pokémon to full 
 :    : health.
@>Recover All: Entire Party
@>Set Move Route: This event
 :              : $>Turn Left
 :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
@>Script: for i in 1..$Trainer.pokemon_count
:       :   pbSet(6, i)
:       :   pbSEPlay("Battle ball shake")
:       :   pbWait(16)
:       : end
@>Set Move Route: [Healing balls]
 :              : $>Stop Animation ON
@>Play ME: 'Pkmn healing', 100, 100
@>Wait: 58 frame(s)
@>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
@>Script: get_character(4).pattern = 0
@>Set Move Route: [Healing balls]
 :              : $>Stop Animation OFF
@>Set Move Route: This event
 :              : $>Wait: 15 frame(s)
 :              : $>Turn Down
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Text: \rYour Pokémon have been healed to perfect health.
@>Set Move Route: This event
 :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 1
 :              : $>Wait: 10 frame(s)

Event ID: 001

Page #1
Conditions

Graphic: trainer_LEADER_Misty

Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Text: \xn[Misty]Hey there, my name's Misty! As you can see, I'm the 
 :    : leader of the Cerulean City Gym!
@>Conditional Branch: Variable [0118: Misty's Gym Challenge] < 3
 @>Text: \xn[Misty]As Gym Leader, I am under obligation to accept 
  :    : your request for battle, however!
 @>Text: \xn[Misty]I will only battle you if you can beat the other three 
  :    : trainers in here. You need to prove that you're a worthy 
  :    : challenger.
 @>Exit Event Processing
 @>
: Branch End
@>Text: \xn[Misty]And, well, it seems you've beaten all the trainers here, 
 :    : so sure! I'll accept your challenge!
@>Text: \xn[Misty]But get ready, my Water-types aren't going to go 
 :    : easy on you!
@>Script: setBattleRule("backdrop", "cerulean")
@>Control Switches: [0104: Transition Handler] = ON
@>Control Variables: [0103: Vs. Transition ID] = 3
@>Call Common Event: Vs. Transition - Badge to Ball Check
@>Control Variables: [0113: Vs. Transition - Badge] = 1
@>Control Variables: [0114: Vs. Transition - Leader] = 1
@>Conditional Branch: Script: pbTrainerBattle(:LEADER_Misty,"Misty",_I("You're way too good for me!"),false,1+$Trainer.badge_count)
 @>
: Else
 @>Exit Event Processing
 @>
: Branch End
@>Text: \xn[Misty]Not bad at all! I was sure we were going to win that 
 :    : battle. Oh well, a loss is a loss!
@>Text: \xn[Misty]Have this Cascade Badge, as proof you bested the 
 :    : Cerulean City gym!
@>Text: \me[Badge get]You earned the Cascade Badge!\wtnp[90]
@>Script: $Trainer.badges[1]=true # Cascade Badge
@>Text: \xn[Misty]Before you go, take this as well.
@>Script: Kernel.pbReceiveItem(:TM70) # Water Pulse, Pokemon
:       : Kernel.pbReceiveItem(:SC03) # Water Pulse, Puppet
@>Conditional Branch: Switch [0108: TM/SC Explanation] == OFF
 @>Text: \xn[Misty]What I just gave you is a Technical Machine and a Skill Card, which allow you to teach moves to your Pokémon and Puppets.
 @>Text: \xn[Misty]There are also special Field Move variants called Hidden Machines and Hidden Skill Cards.
 @>Text: \xn[Misty]All of these have an unlimited number of uses, so you can teach them to any number of your Pokémon or Puppets!
 @>Control Switches: [0108: TM/SC Explanation] = ON
 @>
: Branch End
@>Text: \xn[Misty]Both the TM and the SC are Water Pulse, a Water- and Hydro-Type 
 :    : move that Pokémon and Puppets can learn which has a chance to confuse 
 :    : their foes!
@>Text: \xn[Misty]A pretty nifty move, wouldn't you say?

:       : pbSetSelfSwitch(13,"A",true)

#------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Event ID: 002
Event Name: Nurse
(X,Y): (007,002)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Graphic: NPC 16

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Comment: This line of code sets the player's current position as 
 :       : the spot they will return to after they lose a battle 
 :       : and lack out.
 :       : Page 2 of this event detects when this happens, and 
 :       : heals the player's Pokémon and wishes them better 
 :       : luck in future.
@>Script: pbSetPokemonCenter
@>Text: \rHello, and welcome to the Pokémon Center.
@>Text: \rWe restore your tired Pokémon to full health.
@>Text: \rWould you like to rest your Pokémon?
@>Show Choices: Yes, No
(When Cancel: Choice 2)
: When [Yes]
 @>Text: \rOK, I'll take your Pokémon for a few seconds.
 @>Recover All: Entire Party
 @>Set Move Route: This event
  :              : $>Turn Left
  :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
 @>Wait for Move's Completion
 @>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
 @>Script: count = $Trainer.pokemon_count
 :       : for i in 1..count
 :       :   pbSet(6, i)
 :       :   pbSEPlay("Battle ball shake")
 :       :   pbWait(16)
 :       : end
 @>Set Move Route: [Healing balls]
  :              : $>Stop Animation ON
 @>Play ME: 'Pkmn healing', 100, 100
 @>Wait: 58 frame(s)
 @>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
 @>Script: get_character(4).pattern = 0
 @>Set Move Route: [Healing balls]
  :              : $>Stop Animation OFF
 @>Set Move Route: This event
  :              : $>Wait: 15 frame(s)
  :              : $>Turn Down
 @>Wait for Move's Completion
 @>Conditional Branch: Script: pbPokerus?
  @>Text: \rYour Pokémon may be infected by PokeRus.
  @>Text: \rLittle is known about the PokeRus except that they 
   :    : are microscopic life-forms that attach to Pokémon.
  @>Text: \rWhile infected, Pokémon are said to grow 
   :    : exceptionally well.
  @>Control Switches: [0002: Seen Pokérus in Poké Center] = ON
  @>
 : Else
  @>Text: \rThank you for waiting.
  @>Text: \rWe've restored your Pokémon to full health.
  @>Set Move Route: This event
   :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 1
   :              : $>Wait: 10 frame(s)
   :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 0
  @>Wait for Move's Completion
  @>Text: \rWe hope to see you again!
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: When [No]
 @>Text: \rWe hope to see you again!
 @>
: Branch End
@>

Page #2
Conditions
Switch 0001: Starting over is ON

Graphic: NPC 16

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Autorun

List of Event Commands:
@>Comment: Every map you can end up in after having all your 
 :       : Pokémon faint (typically Poké Centers and home) 
 :       : must have an Autorun event in it like this one.
 :       : This event fully heals all the player's Pokémon, says 
 :       : something to that effect, and turns the "Starting 
 :       : over" switch OFF again.
@>Comment: For convenience, this can be a single page in an 
 :       : NPC's event (e.g. Mom, a nurse).
@>Text: \rFirst, you should restore your Pokémon to full 
 :    : health.
@>Recover All: Entire Party
@>Set Move Route: This event
 :              : $>Turn Left
 :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
@>Script: for i in 1..$Trainer.pokemon_count
:       :   pbSet(6, i)
:       :   pbSEPlay("Battle ball shake")
:       :   pbWait(16)
:       : end
@>Set Move Route: [Healing balls]
 :              : $>Stop Animation ON
@>Play ME: 'Pkmn healing', 100, 100
@>Wait: 58 frame(s)
@>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
@>Script: get_character(4).pattern = 0
@>Set Move Route: [Healing balls]
 :              : $>Stop Animation OFF
@>Set Move Route: This event
 :              : $>Wait: 15 frame(s)
 :              : $>Turn Down
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Text: \rYour Pokémon have been healed to perfect health.
@>Set Move Route: This event
 :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 1
 :              : $>Wait: 10 frame(s)
 :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 0
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Text: \rWe hope you excel!
@>Control Switches: [0001: Starting over] = OFF
@>

  :    : up on Route 25.

  :    : discharges me.

  :    : wanna keep it in my possession too long.

: Else

  :    : be careful with it, it's rather fragile.

 :       : pbSetSelfSwitch2(224,8,"A",true)

Page #1

Graphic: trainer_FISHERMAN

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Text: Hey, would you mind listening to my plight?
@>Show Choices: Yes, No
(When Cancel: Choice 2)
: When [Yes]
 @>Text: I moved to Cerulean City recently. I'd heard it was a wonderful
  :    : place to live, and it certainly looks that way!
 @>Text: When I go to unpack my boxes though, I notice I 
  :    : had one extra box than usual. It was quite peculiar!
 @>Text: Even more peculiar was, one of my boxes started shaking
  :    : and floating around the house!
 @>Text: Whenever I went back in to try and continue, every night without
  :    : fail it would continue to happen!
 @>Text: Since then, I've been held up in the Pokémon Center... I'm not going 
  :    : back into that house until I can figure out how to deal with it.
 @>Text: ...Actually, you seem like someone who enjoys exploring the
  :    : myserious. You wouldn't mind helping to see what's going on
  :    : in my house, right? Great!
 @>Text: It's just north of the Pokémon Center, next to Nugget bridge.
 @>Text: I will easily make it worth your while if you help me out!
  :    : Just please let me get back to unpacking!
 @>Script: activateQuest(:Quest104)

  :    : take your time!

 :              : $>Direction Fix OFF
 :              : $>Move toward Player

 :    : the Kanto and Johto PC Storage System!

@>Text: \xn[Bill]I, hmm...\wt[10] Well, I don't\..\..\..\wtnp[10]
@>Text: \xn[Bill]That's...\wt[10] a difficult thing to answer!
@>Show Animation: Player, [Question bubble]
@>Text: \xn[Bill]Unfortunately, I don't think I can be of any help here.
@>Text: \xn[Bill]Sorry about that!
@>Text: \xn[Bill]To make up for it, I can tell you about my latest project!

 :              : $>Turn Up

 :              : $>Turn Up
@>Set Move Route: [Bill (2)]
 :              : $>Turn Up
@>Text: \xn[Bill]You see, I'm working on a new project. When complete, 
 :    : you'll be able to travel across regions near-instantly!
@>Text: \xn[Bill]Currently, I can only teleport objects across a short
 :    : distance, basically from one side of the room to the other.
@>Text: \xn[Bill]However, I've worked out the math and devised exactly
 :    : what I need to do to get it working.
@>Text: \xn[Bill]As it stands, I'm missing a few more parts. I haven't 
 :    : placed an order on any yet until I know what I need, but I 
 :    : should have it figured out soon!
@>Conditional Branch: Script: $PokemonBag.pbHasItem?(:PACKAGE)
 @>Set Move Route: Player
  :              : $>Turn Left
 @>Wait: 20 frame(s)
 @>Set Move Route: [Bill (2)]
  :              : $>Turn toward Player

 @>Wait: 20 frame(s)
 @>Show Animation: [Bill (2)], [Exclaim bubble]
 @>Text: \xn[Bill]Oh, that must be the custom parts I ordered for 
  :    : upgrading the servers for the Storage System!
 @>Script: $PokemonBag.pbDeleteItem(:PACKAGE)
 @>Text: \PN hands over Bill's Package.\me[Key item get]\wtnp[80]
 @>Text: \xn[Bill]Thanks for delivering this! I assume you must have
  :    : gone out of your way to bring this to me, so here, you can
  :    : have this.
 @>Script: pbReceiveItem(:HM01) # Cut, Pokemon
 :       : pbReceiveItem(:HC01) # Cut, Puppet
 @>Text: \xn[Bill]Those would be the Hidden Machine and the Hidden 
  :    : Skill Card variants of Cut, which you can teach to your

  :    : use them, however.

 @>Call Common Event: Journal Update

 :              : $>Turn Left

 :              : $>Turn Right

(X,Y): (019,014)

Page #1
Conditions

Graphic: NPC 25

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled

List of Event Commands:
@>Text: \xn[Bill] Oh I'm sorry, I didn't hear you come in!
@>Text: \xn[Bill]My name is Bill, I'm the one who developed
 :    : the Kanto and Johto PC Storage System!
@>Script: $PokemonGlobal.seenStorageCreator=true
@>Text: \xn[Bill]May I ask why you've come here?
@>Text: ...
@>Text: Bill: So you were sent here to deliver my
 :    : package? Splendid!
@>Text: \PN hands over Bill's Package.
@>Script: $PokemonBag.pbDeleteItem(PBItems::PACKAGE)
@>Control Switches: [0119] = ON
@>Text: Bill: Excellent, this was the part I needed
 :    : to continue working on my latest project!
@>Text: By the way, how would you like to know
 :    : what it is I'm working on?
@>Text: How would you like to live in a world where people 
 :    : could visit one another in a matter of moments, even 
 :    : if they were regions apart?
@>Text: This device of mine will rectify that! I
 :    : present the prototype of the very first
 :    : Regional Teleporter!
@>Text: Currently it only teleports within a short
 :    : distance, but if my calculations were
 :    : correct,
@>Text: a few more adjustments and
 :    : regional teleportation will be a thing of
 :    : the present!
@>Set Move Route: [Bill (2)]
 :              : $>Turn Up
@>Text: Oh the possibilities of such technology,
 :    : and to think I'll be the one to have done it...
@>Show Animation: [Bill (2)], [Exclaim bubble]
@>Set Move Route: [Bill (2)]
 :              : $>Turn toward Player
@>Text: Oh my, I didn't realize I was rambling! I just get 
 :    : so caught up in talking about my inventions that 
 :    : I lose track of time!
@>Text: Do forgive me for taking up your time. Please, 
 :    : take this as a token of my appologies.
@>Script: Kernel.pbReceiveItem(PBItems::G18HM01)

@>Script: setTempSwitchOn("A")

@>Comment: This line of code sets the player's current position as 
 :       : the spot they will return to after they lose a battle 
 :       : and lack out.
 :       : Page 2 of this event detects when this happens, and 
 :       : heals the player's Pokémon and wishes them better 
 :       : luck in future.
@>Script: pbSetPokemonCenter
@>Text: \rHello, and welcome to the Pokémon Center.
@>Text: \rWe restore your tired Pokémon to full health.
@>Text: \rWould you like to rest your Pokémon?
@>Show Choices: Yes, No
(When Cancel: Choice 2)
: When [Yes]
 @>Text: \rOK, I'll take your Pokémon for a few seconds.
 @>Recover All: Entire Party
 @>Set Move Route: This event
  :              : $>Turn Left
  :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
 @>Wait for Move's Completion
 @>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
 @>Script: count = $Trainer.pokemon_count
 :       : for i in 1..count
 :       :   pbSet(6, i)

 :       :   pbWait(16)
 :       : end

  :              : $>Stop Animation ON

  :              : $>Stop Animation OFF
 @>Set Move Route: This event
  :              : $>Wait: 15 frame(s)
  :              : $>Turn Down
 @>Wait for Move's Completion
 @>Conditional Branch: Script: pbPokerus?
  @>Text: \rYour Pokémon may be infected by PokeRus.
  @>Text: \rLittle is known about the PokeRus except that they 
   :    : are microscopic life-forms that attach to Pokémon.

   :    : exceptionally well.

 : Else

   :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 1
   :              : $>Wait: 10 frame(s)
   :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 0
  @>Wait for Move's Completion
  @>Text: \rWe hope to see you again!
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: When [No]
 @>Text: \rWe hope to see you again!
 @>

@>

Page #2
Conditions
Switch 0001: Starting over is ON

Graphic: NPC 16

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Autorun

List of Event Commands:
@>Comment: Every map you can end up in after having all your 
 :       : Pokémon faint (typically Poké Centers and home) 
 :       : must have an Autorun event in it like this one.
 :       : This event fully heals all the player's Pokémon, says 
 :       : something to that effect, and turns the "Starting 
 :       : over" switch OFF again.
@>Comment: For convenience, this can be a single page in an 
 :       : NPC's event (e.g. Mom, a nurse).
@>Text: \rFirst, you should restore your Pokémon to full 
 :    : health.
@>Recover All: Entire Party
@>Set Move Route: This event
 :              : $>Turn Left
 :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0

:       :   pbSet(6, i)

:       :   pbWait(16)
:       : end

 :              : $>Stop Animation ON

@>Wait: 58 frame(s)
@>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0

 :              : $>Stop Animation OFF
@>Set Move Route: This event
 :              : $>Wait: 15 frame(s)
 :              : $>Turn Down
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Text: \rYour Pokémon have been healed to perfect health.
@>Set Move Route: This event
 :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 1
 :              : $>Wait: 10 frame(s)
 :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 0
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Text: \rWe hope you excel!
@>Control Switches: [0001: Starting over] = OFF

  :    : family working there.
 @>Text: Still, while I doubt you have one, I'll need to see an 
  :    : Echo Pass. You can't just buy one of those either, so 
  :    : if you don't have one you're out of luck.
 @>Conditional Branch: Script: $PokemonBag.pbQuantity(:ECHOPASS)>0
  @>Text: *\pn smugly pulled out her Echo Pass and waved it 
   :    : infront of the Sailor*
  @>Text: Well I'll be, it seems you do have one! Well alright 
   :    : then, I guess you can head to the Kikoto Continent!
  @>Text: All those for the S.S. Echo, boarding now!
  @>Play SE: 'Exit Door', 80, 100
  @>Change Screen Color Tone: (-255,-255,-255,0), @6
  @>Wait: 6 frame(s)
  @>Comment: Make sure this is set back to Kikoto Adoption Agency
  @>Transfer Player:[022: Zirconial Ocean], (003,004), Up, No Fade
  @>Change Screen Color Tone: (0,0,0,0), @6
  @>
 : Else
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: Branch End
@>

 (When Cancel: Choice 4)
 : When [Gym Leader Preference]
  @>Text: The Vermilion City Gym, Lt. Surge, has a preference for
   :    : Electric Pokémon and Wind Puppets.
  @>Text: Aside from the traditional weaknesses of Electric-type
   :    : Pokémon, Wind-type Puppets are weak to Earth-typed
   :    : moves.
  @>Text: Wind-Type Puppets resist damage from Aero and 
   :    : Wind-typed moves.
  @>Jump to Label: Start
  @>
 : When [Gym Mechanics]
  @>Text: Lt. Surge, using his expertise in warfare, has designed his 
   :    : gym to reflect a training ground for recruits.
  @>Text: There are two ways to navigate the gym. The first is 
   :    : through a gauntlet of trainers, which Lt. Surge calls the 
   :    : "Head-On Course".
  @>Text: The second one requires navigating a simulated battlefield
   :    : with Voltorbs littered in the ground as landmines. Tripping a
   :    : landmine will send you back to the beginning of that course.
  @>Text: In order to avoid tripping the landmines, it is advised to not
   :    : run through the gym, or to bring a party member with 
   :    : Magnet Pull.
  @>Text: At the end, Lt. Surge will be blocked off by his trademark
   :    : electrified fencing.
  @>Text: Prospective challengers must disable the two generators 
   :    : that power the fencing before they can battle the Gym 
   :    : Leader.
  @>Jump to Label: Start
  @>
 : When [Gym Leader Information]
  @>Text: Lt. Surge, though he makes his home in Kanto, was born 
   :    : and raised in the greater Unova Region.
  @>Text: He served in the Kanto Armed Forces during the Tohjo Civil War,
   :    : where he earned the nickname "The Lightning Unovan" for his
   :    : tactics involving Electric Pokémon.
  @>Text: After the gym was over, he was chosen as next in line to
   :    : serve as Vermilion City's Gym Leader when the previous one
   :    : stepped down.
  @>Text: Since then, Vermilion Gym has gained a reputation as being
   :    : effectively a boot camp in all but name.
  @>Jump to Label: Start
  @>
 : When [Nothing]
  @>Text: Shutting down information database.
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: Else
 @>
: Branch End
@>

#------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Event ID: 002
Event Name: Nurse
(X,Y): (007,002)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Graphic: NPC 16

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Comment: This line of code sets the player's current position as 
 :       : the spot they will return to after they lose a battle 
 :       : and lack out.
 :       : Page 2 of this event detects when this happens, and 
 :       : heals the player's Pokémon and wishes them better 
 :       : luck in future.
@>Script: pbSetPokemonCenter
@>Text: \rHello, and welcome to the Pokémon Center.
@>Text: \rWe restore your tired Pokémon to full health.
@>Text: \rWould you like to rest your Pokémon?
@>Show Choices: Yes, No
(When Cancel: Choice 2)
: When [Yes]
 @>Text: \rOK, I'll take your Pokémon for a few seconds.
 @>Recover All: Entire Party
 @>Set Move Route: This event
  :              : $>Turn Left
  :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
 @>Wait for Move's Completion
 @>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
 @>Script: count = $Trainer.pokemon_count
 :       : for i in 1..count
 :       :   pbSet(6, i)
 :       :   pbSEPlay("Battle ball shake")
 :       :   pbWait(16)
 :       : end
 @>Set Move Route: [Healing balls]
  :              : $>Stop Animation ON
 @>Play ME: 'Pkmn healing', 100, 100
 @>Wait: 58 frame(s)
 @>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
 @>Script: get_character(4).pattern = 0
 @>Set Move Route: [Healing balls]
  :              : $>Stop Animation OFF
 @>Set Move Route: This event
  :              : $>Wait: 15 frame(s)
  :              : $>Turn Down
 @>Wait for Move's Completion
 @>Conditional Branch: Script: pbPokerus?
  @>Text: \rYour Pokémon may be infected by PokeRus.
  @>Text: \rLittle is known about the PokeRus except that they 
   :    : are microscopic life-forms that attach to Pokémon.
  @>Text: \rWhile infected, Pokémon are said to grow 
   :    : exceptionally well.
  @>Control Switches: [0002: Seen Pokérus in Poké Center] = ON
  @>
 : Else
  @>Text: \rThank you for waiting.
  @>Text: \rWe've restored your Pokémon to full health.
  @>Set Move Route: This event
   :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 1
   :              : $>Wait: 10 frame(s)
   :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 0
  @>Wait for Move's Completion
  @>Text: \rWe hope to see you again!
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: When [No]
 @>Text: \rWe hope to see you again!
 @>
: Branch End
@>

Page #2
Conditions
Switch 0001: Starting over is ON

Graphic: NPC 16

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Autorun

List of Event Commands:
@>Comment: Every map you can end up in after having all your 
 :       : Pokémon faint (typically Poké Centers and home) 
 :       : must have an Autorun event in it like this one.
 :       : This event fully heals all the player's Pokémon, says 
 :       : something to that effect, and turns the "Starting 
 :       : over" switch OFF again.
@>Comment: For convenience, this can be a single page in an 
 :       : NPC's event (e.g. Mom, a nurse).
@>Text: \rFirst, you should restore your Pokémon to full 
 :    : health.
@>Recover All: Entire Party
@>Set Move Route: This event
 :              : $>Turn Left
 :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
@>Script: for i in 1..$Trainer.pokemon_count
:       :   pbSet(6, i)
:       :   pbSEPlay("Battle ball shake")
:       :   pbWait(16)
:       : end
@>Set Move Route: [Healing balls]
 :              : $>Stop Animation ON
@>Play ME: 'Pkmn healing', 100, 100
@>Wait: 58 frame(s)
@>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
@>Script: get_character(4).pattern = 0
@>Set Move Route: [Healing balls]
 :              : $>Stop Animation OFF
@>Set Move Route: This event
 :              : $>Wait: 15 frame(s)
 :              : $>Turn Down
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Text: \rYour Pokémon have been healed to perfect health.
@>Set Move Route: This event
 :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 1
 :              : $>Wait: 10 frame(s)
 :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 0
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Text: \rWe hope you excel!
@>Control Switches: [0001: Starting over] = OFF
@>

  :    : goods, so that's nifty!

Event Name: EV010
(X,Y): (018,000)

Page #1
Conditions
Variable 0107: Chosen Protag is 0 or above
Self Switch A is ON

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Autorun

List of Event Commands:
@>Script: TrainerIntro2(:SCMary)
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]Renko, over here!
@>Set Move Route: Player
 :              : $>Move Up
 :              : $>Move Up
 :              : $>Move Up
 :              : $>Move Up
 :              : $>Move Right
 :              : $>Move Right
 :              : $>Move Right
 :              : $>Move Right
@>Set Move Route: [Renko/Maribel]
 :              : $>Turn toward Player
 :              : $>Turn toward Player
 :              : $>Turn toward Player
 :              : $>Turn toward Player
 :              : $>Turn toward Player
 :              : $>Turn toward Player
 :              : $>Turn toward Player
 :              : $>Turn toward Player
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Text: \xn[Renko]So, you mentioned back at the hotel that you had more
 :    : leads?
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]I came across some while I was doing research, yeah.
 :    : I think I mentioned that the Power Plant was one of them, actually.
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]You wouldn't have happened to have seen or heard
 :    : anything strange inside the Power Plant, did you Renko?
@>Text: \xn[Renko]Does the army of gangsters causing a ruckus count
 :    : as a something strange?
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]No, but even then I wouldn't even know what to look for...
 :    : There were tabloid reports about unexplainable phenomena coming from
 :    : the Power Plant at night sometimes.
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]However, having taken a look for myself, It could possibly
 :    : just be the cave not too far from the Plant.
@>Text: \xn[Renko]Then yeah, I didn't see anything abnormal inside the
 :    : Power Plant.
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]Oh well! Fortunately, I had a few other leads worth
 :    : looking into!
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]You see, while I was doing research into Kanto's history,
 :    : I came across two other interesting locations!
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]The first one is Lavender Town, it's a place with a
 :    : strong affinity toward the supernatural.
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]Supposedly, there's a clan that resides there that has
 :    : resided in the Tohjo Continent for over 200 years.
@>Text: \xn[Renko]A clan that's in tune with the supernatural, huh?
 :    : It sounds like a good as lead as any!
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]Another place I learned of was Fuchsia City, where 
 :    : some ancient ruins were discovered not too long ago.
@>Text: \xn[Renko]Ancient ruins? Was there any information about them?
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]Nope! Apparently people believed they were part of a 
 :    : place called the Safari Zone, but never opened to the public.
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]They were found in close proximity to the facility, but
 :    : when the former Warden was asked about it, he had no clue what
 :    : they were talking about.
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]Initial research into the ruins show that they've
 :    : existed for several hundred years, and belonged to a clan
 :    : that existed in Kanto during that same time period.
@>Text: \xn[Renko]Hmm... While it doesn't seem related on the surface, it's
 :    : hard to deny there could be a connection to the Sealed Realm.
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]I'm thinking the same thing... Actually, I was thinking about
 :    : heading over there to investigate them myself.
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]I'm not sure what it is, but something about them sticks out
 :    : to me.
@>Text: \xn[Renko]Hm! So, shall I go hit up Lavender Town while you check out
 :    : those ruins?
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]That sounds like a good idea to me! If one of us
 :    : finishes up first, then we can go meet up with the other to
 :    : help!
@>Text: \xn[Renko]You read my mind, Mary!
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]Well then, Lavender Town is just south of here, you have to
 :    : cross Rock Tunnel to get to it.
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]Meanwhile, I have to take the long and winding road
 :    : down Cycling Road to get to Fuchsia City... At least it'll be an
 :    : enjoyable downhill ride on a bike!
@>Text: \xn[Renko]You should probably hit the road right now then,
 :    : give yourself a good amount of time to get there and get
 :    : exploring!
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]I think I'll do just that! Good luck in Lavender Town,
 :    : Renko! Here's to hoping we finally find something!
@>Text: \xn[Renko]Same to you, Mary!
@>Fade Out BGM: 4 sec.
@>Set Move Route: [Renko/Maribel]
 :              : $>Move Up
 :              : $>Move Left
 :              : $>Move Left
 :              : $>Move Left
 :              : $>Move Left
 :              : $>Move Left
 :              : $>Move Down
 :              : $>Move Down
 :              : $>Move Down
 :              : $>Move Down
 :              : $>Move Down
 :              : $>Change Opacity: 0
 :              : $>SE: 'Door exit', 80, 100
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Text: \xn[Renko]Lavender Town, huh? Best not waste anymore time 
 :    : here!
@>Play BGM: 'W-008. Pokemon Center (Monsekai)', 100, 100
@>Script: completeQuest(:Quest18)
:       : activateQuest(:Quest20)
@>Script: pbSetSelfSwitch(9,"B",true)
:       : pbSetSelfSwitch2(55,13,"C",true)
@>Control Self Switch: B =ON
@>

@>Set Move Route: Player
 :              : $>Move Up

 :              : $>Move Up

 :              : $>Move Right
 :              : $>Move Right

 :              : $>Turn toward Player

 :              : $>Turn toward Player
 :              : $>Turn toward Player
 :              : $>Turn toward Player
 :              : $>Turn toward Player
 :              : $>Turn toward Player
 :              : $>Turn toward Player
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]That was quite the experience, but I believe it's time 
 :    : we got back to our discussion earlier... You said you had more leads?
@>Text: \xn[Renko]Yep! The Power Plant was one of them, actually. Tell 
 :    : me, did you notice anything strange while inside the Plant?
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]You mean aside from the gangsters that were making a 
 :    : mess of the place? No, not really.
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]Was there something I should have seen?
@>Text: \xn[Renko]Hmm, that's the thing, I don't know. I just heard rumors that
 :    : people've heard strange noises coming from the vicinity of the Power
 :    : Plant at night sometimes.
@>Text: \xn[Renko]Of course, it could very well have been coming from 
 :    : that cave not too far from the Plant.
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]Hmm, well if there was anything abnormal, I sure didn't 
 :    : notice it.
@>Text: \xn[Renko]Guess that lead was a bust! But, I still have other leads
 :    : we can look into.
@>Text: \xn[Renko]So, while I was doing research into the history of 
 :    : Kanto, I came across two other locations of interest.
@>Text: \xn[Renko]The first is Lavender Town, a place with a great affinity to
 :    : the spiritual and supernatural.
@>Text: \xn[Renko]Apparently there's a really old clan there that dates 
 :    : back hundreds of years.
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]That could work as a possible lead... if they've been 
 :    : around that long, then surely they must have some idea of 
 :    : what the Sealed Realm could be.
@>Text: \xn[Renko]I know, right? The other place is Fuchsia City, home 
 :    : of the Safari Zone- well, before it was closed down that is.
@>Text: \xn[Renko]Apparently some time after the Safari Zone closed,
 :    : ancient ruins were found further into the Safari Zone's territory.
@>Text: \xn[Renko]At first it was believed that these ruins were made by
 :    : the Safari Zone Warden, but never opened to the public, but he
 :    : has no clue what those ruins even are.
@>Text: \xn[Renko]Preliminary research into them indicates that the ruins
 :    : belonged to an ancient clan that existed in Kanto several hundred
 :    : years ago.
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]Ancient ruins that haven't been touched for hundreds of years...
 :    : Even if they aren't related to the Sealed Realm, they could be interesting
 :    : all the same!
@>Text: \xn[Renko]Call it a hunch, but I get the feeling those Ruins are definitely
 :    : tied to the Sealed Realm. I don't know how yet, but I'm willing to look into
 :    : it myself!
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]So, you hit up Fuchsia City and I hit up Lavender Town?
@>Text: \xn[Renko]Sounds like a plan to me! You've got the quicker journey ahead
 :    : of you, Lavender Town is just past Rock Tunnel, right here on Route 10!
@>Text: \xn[Renko]Meanwhile, I need to detour all the way through Celadon
 :    : City to get to Fuchsia City. At least the trainers on Cycling Road
 :    : might make for a good training session for my partners!
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]Perhaps if one of us finishes up before the other, we 
 :    : can meet back up with each other to lend our aid!
@>Text: \xn[Renko]Exactly what I was thinking, Mary!
@>Text: \xn[Renko]I should go hit the road while there's still day to burn,
 :    : so I'll catch you later Mary!
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]Safe travels, Renko! Here's to hoping our leads pay off!
@>Fade Out BGM: 4 sec.
@>Set Move Route: [Renko/Maribel]
 :              : $>Move Up
 :              : $>Move Left
 :              : $>Move Left
 :              : $>Move Left
 :              : $>Move Left
 :              : $>Move Left
 :              : $>Move Down
 :              : $>Move Down
 :              : $>Move Down
 :              : $>Move Down
 :              : $>Move Down
 :              : $>Change Opacity: 0
 :              : $>SE: 'Door exit', 80, 100
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]Lavender Town, is it? I wonder what kind of place
 :    : it'll be like! Time to get going!
@>Play BGM: 'W-008. Pokemon Center (Monsekai)', 100, 100

    :              : $>Through ON

    :              : $>Wait: 4 frame(s)
    :              : $>Jump: +0,+0
   @>Wait for Move's Completion
   @>Script: pbSetSelfSwitch(2,"A",true)
   @>Wait: 40 frame(s)
   @>Set Weather Effects: None, @80
   @>Wait: 20 frame(s)
   @>Show Animation: Player, [Exclaim bubble]
   @>Screen Flash: (255,255,255,255), @10
   @>Play SE: 'Vs flash', 80, 100
   @>Wait: 30 frame(s)
   @>Screen Flash: (255,255,255,255), @10
   @>Play SE: 'Vs flash', 80, 100
   @>Wait: 30 frame(s)
   @>Screen Flash: (255,255,255,255), @60

Event Name: Selene
(X,Y): (010,003)

Type: Fixed

Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled

List of Event Commands:
@>Text: Oh, hello there. My name is Selene, leader of the Lavender Town Gym...
@>Text: Selene: At least, that's what I would say, if this was an official gym.
@>Text: But that will all change today! The Kanto Gym Committe is comming over here today to test me and see if I'm qualified to run this gym!
@>Text: However, I have a small problem...
@>Text: For a while, the Gym has been haunted by Ghost Puppets, and they scare everyone away.
@>Text: I've tried scaring them off, but they just keep coming back...
@>Text: Selene: Let's make a deal! If you can clear out all the Ghosts, I'll let you challenge me to a gym battle!
@>Text: I don't have any badges I can give out... But the experience never hurts, right?
@>Control Self Switch: A =ON
@>Script: pbSetSelfSwitch(3,"A",true)
@>Script: pbSetSelfSwitch(4,"A",true)
@>Script: pbSetSelfSwitch(5,"A",true)

Event ID: 010
Event Name: Name Rater
(X,Y): (042,004)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Graphic: NPC 10

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Text: \bHello, hello!\nI am the official Name Rater!
@>Text: \bWant me to rate the nicknames of your Pokémon?
@>Show Choices: Yes, No
(When Cancel: Choice 2)
: When [Yes]
 @>Text: \bWhich Pokémon's nickname should I critique?
 @>Comment: Opens a screen for choosing a Pokémon. The index 
  :       : is stored in Game Variable 1, and the name in Game 
  :       : Variable 3.
 @>Script: pbChoosePokemon(1, 3)
 @>Comment: If Game Variable 1 is less than 0, it means the player 
  :       : has canceled choosing a Pokémon.
 @>Conditional Branch: Variable [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] < 0
  @>Text: \bI see.\nDo come visit again.
  @>Exit Event Processing
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>Comment: Check for eggs.
 @>Conditional Branch: Script: pbGetPokemon(1).egg?
  @>Text: \bNow, now... That is merely an Egg!
  @>Exit Event Processing
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>Comment: Check for Shadow Pokémon.
 @>Conditional Branch: Script: pbGetPokemon(1).shadowPokemon?
  @>Text: \bI wouldn't dare critique a Shadow Pokémon's name!
  @>Exit Event Processing
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>Conditional Branch: Script: pbGetPokemon(1).foreign?($Trainer)
  @>Text: \bHmmm... \v[3] it is!
  @>Text: \bThis is a magnificent nickname! It is impeccably 
   :    : beyond reproach!
  @>Text: \bYou'll do well to cherish your \v[3] now and 
   :    : beyond.
  @>Exit Event Processing
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>Text: \b\v[3], is it?\nThat is a decent nickname!
 @>Text: \bBut, would you like me to give it a nicer name?
 @>Text: \bHow about it?
 @>Show Choices: Yes, No
 (When Cancel: Choice 2)
 : When [Yes]
  @>Text: \bAh, good. Then, what shall the new nickname be?
  @>Script: pkmn = pbGetPokemon(1)
  :       : species = pkmn.speciesName
  :       : pbSet(4, species)
  :       : pbTextEntry("#{species}'s nickname?",
  :       :   0, Pokemon::MAX_NAME_SIZE, 5)
  @>Conditional Branch: Script: pbGet(5) == pbGet(3) || (pbGet(5) == "" && pbGet(3) == pbGet(4))
   @>Comment: The Pokémon's nickname wasn't changed.
   @>Text: \bI see. You're right, there's no need to change this 
    :    : Pokémon's nickname.
   @>Text: \bIt already had a superb name!
   @>
  : Else
   @>Conditional Branch: Script: pbGet(5) == "" || pbGet(5) == pbGet(4)
    @>Comment: Resets the Pokémon's nickname to the species name.
    @>Script: pkmn = pbGetPokemon(1)
    :       : pkmn.name = nil
    :       : pbSet(3, pkmn.name)
    @>Text: \bDone! From now on, this Pokémon shall be known
     :    : as \v[3]!
    @>Text: \bIt looks no different from before, and yet, this is 
     :    : vastly superior!
    @>Text: \bHow fortunate for you!
    @>
   : Else
    @>Comment: Retrieves the Pokémon whose party index is stored in 
     :       : Game Variable 1, and changes its name to the name 
     :       : stored in Game Variable 5.
    @>Script: pkmn = pbGetPokemon(1)
    :       : pkmn.name = pbGet(5)
    @>Text: \bDone! From now on, this Pokémon shall be known
     :    : as \v[5]!
    @>Text: \bIt is a better name than before!\nHow fortunate for 
     :    : you!
    @>
   : Branch End
   @>
  : Branch End
  @>
 : When [No]
  @>Text: \bI see.\nDo come visit again.
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: When [No]
 @>Text: \bI see.\nDo come visit again.
 @>
: Branch End
@>

 :       : the spot they will return to after they lose a battle 
 :       : and lack out.
 :       : Page 2 of this event detects when this happens, and 
 :       : heals the player's Pokémon and wishes them better 
 :       : luck in future.

@>Text: \rHello, and welcome to the Pokémon Center.
@>Text: \rWe restore your tired Pokémon to full health.
@>Text: \rWould you like to rest your Pokémon?

  :              : $>Turn Left
  :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)

 :       : end

   :    : are microscopic life-forms that attach to Pokémon.

 :       : Pokémon faint (typically Poké Centers and home) 
 :       : must have an Autorun event in it like this one.
 :       : This event fully heals all the player's Pokémon, says 
 :       : something to that effect, and turns the "Starting 
 :       : over" switch OFF again.

 :       : NPC's event (e.g. Mom, a nurse).

 :    : health.

@>Set Move Route: This event
 :              : $>Turn Left
 :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)

@>Set Move Route: Player
 :              : $>Turn Left
@>Text: \xn[\pn]That's because I'm not a Youkai! I keep saying it, but
 :    : I'm just a human!
@>Text: Then how do you know about the <i>gensou kyou</i>!? The existence
 :    : of it has been kept concealed from the general public ever since
 :    : the realm was sealed away almost 200 years ago!
@>Set Move Route: Player
 :              : $>Turn Right
@>Text: \xn[\pn]The\..\..\.. <i>gensou kyou</i>? Is that what the "Sealed Realm"
 :    : is called?
@>Text: \xn[Head Priestess]You really don't know, do you?
@>Set Move Route: Player
 :              : $>Turn Up
@>Text: \xn[\pn]That's what I've been trying to say all this time! I'm doing
 :    : research on the Sealed Realm with a friend of mine!
@>Text: \xn[\pn]That's the purpose of our club, the discovery of the 
 :    : supernatural, and to uncover the truth behind the Sealed Realm!
@>Text: \xn[Head Priestess]This is not knowledge fit for the average

 :    : humans for a reason.
@>Text: \xn[\pn]Even so, we wish to know! This is our life's work, and
 :    : if you have information on it, please tell me!
@>Text: \xn[Head Priestess]The youth these days... truly impetuous and
 :    : carefree.
@>Text: \xn[Head Priestess]Seeking out knowledge of things that they
 :    : can't even begin to understand.
@>Text: \xn[Head Priestess]It has been our job to maintain the secrecy
 :    : of the existence of the <i>gensou kyou</i>.
@>Text: \xn[Head Priestess]You truly think that we'll just tell you
 :    : because you ask?
@>Text: \xn[\pn]No, I suppose not...\wt[10] But, it's still worth a shot! We've come
 :    : this far, and we'll pursue every avenue we can until we achieve our
 :    : goals!
@>Wait: 25 frame(s)
@>Text: \xn[Head Priestess]...Hmph. I see you won't be disuaded so
 :    : easily.
@>Comment: -----------
@>Text: \xn[Head Priestess]If you want to be tested so bad, then
 :    : so be it!
@>Screen Flash: (255,255,255,255), @20
@>Set Move Route: Player
 :              : $>Always on Top OFF
@>Script: pbSetSelfSwitch(10,"A",false)
@>Text: \xn[Head Priestess]We are the keepers of this knowledge. If
 :    : you wish to inherit it, then you must prove you are worthy of it!
@>Text: \xn[Head Priestess]If you are found to be lacking, then you
 :    : will have met a dead end here.

@>Control Self Switch: A =ON
@>

#------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Event ID: 001
Event Name: Gym Terminal
(X,Y): (008,006)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Graphic: gymtelecom

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Conditional Branch: Player is facing Right
 @>Text: Accessing Gym Network.
 @>Label: Start
 @>Text: Please select what you want to know about.
 @>Show Choices: Gym Leader Preference, Gym Mechanics, Gym Leader Information, Nothing
 (When Cancel: Choice 4)
 : When [Gym Leader Preference]
  @>Text: The Vermilion City Gym, Lt. Surge, has a preference for
   :    : Electric Pokémon and Wind Puppets.
  @>Text: Aside from the traditional weaknesses of Electric-type
   :    : Pokémon, Wind-type Puppets are weak to Earth-typed
   :    : moves.
  @>Text: Wind-Type Puppets resist damage from Aero and 
   :    : Wind-typed moves.
  @>Jump to Label: Start
  @>
 : When [Gym Mechanics]
  @>Text: Lt. Surge, using his expertise in warfare, has designed his 
   :    : gym to reflect a training ground for recruits.
  @>Text: There are two ways to navigate the gym. The first is 
   :    : through a gauntlet of trainers, which Lt. Surge calls the 
   :    : "Head-On Course".
  @>Text: The second one requires navigating a simulated battlefield
   :    : with Voltorbs littered in the ground as landmines. Tripping a
   :    : landmine will send you back to the beginning of that course.
  @>Text: In order to avoid tripping the landmines, it is advised to not
   :    : run through the gym, or to bring a party member with 
   :    : Magnet Pull.
  @>Text: At the end, Lt. Surge will be blocked off by his trademark
   :    : electrified fencing.
  @>Text: Prospective challengers must disable the two generators 
   :    : that power the fencing before they can battle the Gym 
   :    : Leader.
  @>Jump to Label: Start
  @>
 : When [Gym Leader Information]
  @>Text: Lt. Surge, though he makes his home in Kanto, was born 
   :    : and raised in the greater Unova Region.
  @>Text: He served in the Kanto Armed Forces during the Tohjo Civil War,
   :    : where he earned the nickname "The Lightning Unovan" for his
   :    : tactics involving Electric Pokémon.
  @>Text: After the gym was over, he was chosen as next in line to
   :    : serve as Vermilion City's Gym Leader when the previous one
   :    : stepped down.
  @>Text: Since then, Vermilion Gym has gained a reputation as being
   :    : effectively a boot camp in all but name.
  @>Jump to Label: Start
  @>
 : When [Nothing]
  @>Text: Shutting down information database.
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: Else
 @>
: Branch End
@>

 :       : Shrine
@>Conditional Branch: Script: $game_variables[105]==31415926
 @>Control Switches: [0031: Shiny wild Pokémon] = ON
 @>Text: \bThe next wild Pokemon encounter will produce a
  :    : Shiny Pokemon.
 @>Exit Event Processing
 @>
: Else
 @>
: Branch End
@>Comment: --- 50 Cherish Balls: 28092006, Viridian PokeCenter
@>Conditional Branch: Script: $game_variables[105]==28092006
 @>Conditional Branch: Switch [0077: 50 Cherish Balls] == ON
  @>Text: \bYou have already redeemed the code for 50 
   :    : Cherish Balls.
  @>Exit Event Processing
  @>
 : Else
  @>Text: \bRedeeming this code will give you 50 Cherish Balls. 
   :    : Once claimed, you will not be able to redeem this code
   :    : again.
  @>Text: \bWould you like to redeem this code?
  @>Show Choices: Yes, No
  (When Cancel: Choice 2)
  : When [Yes]
   @>Control Switches: [0077: 50 Cherish Balls] = ON
   @>Script: pbReceiveItem(:CHERISHBALL,50)
   @>
  : When [No]
   @>Exit Event Processing
   @>
  : Branch End
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>Exit Event Processing
 @>
: Else
 @>
: Branch End
@>Comment: --- Cute Charm Kyouko: 13082011, Release Post
@>Conditional Branch: Script: $game_variables[105]==13082011
 @>Conditional Branch: Switch [0079: Cute Charm Kyouko] == ON
  @>Text: \bThe special Kyouko has already been obtained. 
   :    : This code cannot be used.
  @>Exit Event Processing
  @>
 : Else
  @>Text: \bThis code will add a Chibi Kyouko with the hidden 
   :    : ability Cute Charm to your party. If your party is full, it 
   :    : will be sent to your box.
  @>Text: \bOnce claimed, you will not be able to renew this code
   :    : again.
  @>Text: \bAre you capable of recieving this gift?
  @>Show Choices: Yes, No
  (When Cancel: Choice 2)
  : When [Yes]
   @>Script: pkmn=Pokemon.new(:CKYOUKO,10)
   :       : pkmn.item = :GREENUFO
   :       : pkmn.ability = :CUTECHARM
   :       : pkmn.happiness = 255
   :       : pkmn.iv[:HP]=15
   :       : pkmn.iv[:ATTACK]=15
   :       : pkmn.iv[:DEFENSE]=15
   :       : pkmn.iv[:SPECIAL_ATTACK]=15
   :       : pkmn.iv[:SPECIAL_DEFENSE]=15
   :       : pkmn.iv[:SPEED]=15
   @>Script: pkmn.calc_stats
   :       : pbAddPokemon(pkmn)
   @>Control Switches: [0079: Cute Charm Kyouko] = ON
   @>Exit Event Processing
   @>
  : When [No]
   @>Exit Event Processing
   @>
  : Branch End
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>Exit Event Processing
 @>
: Else
 @>
: Branch End
@>Comment: --- Diva Yamame: 16082008, Celadon City
@>Conditional Branch: Script: $game_variables[105]==16082008
 @>Conditional Branch: Switch [0078: Diva Yamame] == ON
  @>Text: \bThe special Kyouko has already been obtained. 
   :    : This code cannot be used.
  @>Exit Event Processing
  @>
 : Else
  @>Text: \bThis code will add a Evolved Yamame with the hidden 
   :    : ability Diva to your party. If your party is full, it 
   :    : will be sent to your box.
  @>Text: \bOnce claimed, you will not be able to renew this code
   :    : again.
  @>Text: \bAre you capable of recieving this gift?
  @>Show Choices: Yes, No
  (When Cancel: Choice 2)
  : When [Yes]
   @>Script: pkmn=Pokemon.new(:YAMAME,30)
   :       : pkmn.item = :BLUEUFO
   :       : pkmn.ability = :DIVA
   :       : pkmn.happiness = 255
   :       : pkmn.iv[:HP]=15
   :       : pkmn.iv[:ATTACK]=15
   :       : pkmn.iv[:DEFENSE]=15
   :       : pkmn.iv[:SPECIAL_ATTACK]=15
   :       : pkmn.iv[:SPECIAL_DEFENSE]=15
   :       : pkmn.iv[:SPEED]=15
   @>Script: pkmn.calc_stats
   :       : 
   :       : pkmn.learn_move(:PERFORMANCE18)
   :       : pkmn.learn_move(:CROSSPOISON18)
   :       : pkmn.learn_move(:MUDSHOT18)
   :       : pkmn.learn_move(:STUNSPORE18)
   :       : pkmn.record_first_moves
   :       : 
   :       : pbAddPokemon(pkmn)
   @>Control Switches: [0078: Diva Yamame] = ON
   @>Exit Event Processing
   @>
  : When [No]
   @>Exit Event Processing
   @>
  : Branch End
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>Exit Event Processing
 @>
: Else
 @>
: Branch End
@>Comment: --- Silph Co. Invitation: 29121997, Event Distribution
@>Conditional Branch: Script: $game_variables[105]==29121997
 @>Conditional Branch: Switch [0080: Silph Co. Invite] == ON
  @>Text: \bYou have already redeemed the code for the
   :    : Silph Co. Invitation.
  @>Exit Event Processing
  @>
 : Else
  @>Text: \bRedeeming this code will give you a Silph Co. Invitation. 
   :    : Once claimed, you will not be able to redeem this code
   :    : again.
  @>Text: \bWould you like to redeem this code?
  @>Show Choices: Yes, No
  (When Cancel: Choice 2)
  : When [Yes]
   @>Control Switches: [0080: Silph Co. Invite] = ON
   @>Script: pbReceiveItem(:SILPHINVITE)
   @>
  : When [No]
   @>Exit Event Processing
   @>
  : Branch End
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>Exit Event Processing
 @>
: Else
 @>
: Branch End
@>Comment: --- Enables Debug Mode: 91036093, Final Sidequest

  :    : responsibly.

  :    : reload the game.

 @>
: Else
 @>
: Branch End

#==============================================================================
Common Event ID: 087
Common Event Name: Vs. Transition - Badge to Ball Check

Trigger: None

List of Event Commands:
@>Comment: Checks for how many badges the player has.
 :       : Used for determining the ball count for Gym Leaders.
@>Conditional Branch: Script: $Trainer.badge_count == 0
 @>Comment: 0 Badges
 @>Control Variables: [0104: Vs. Transition - Pkmn] = 2
 @>
: Else
 @>Conditional Branch: Script: $Trainer.badge_count == 1
  @>Comment: 1 Badge
  @>Control Variables: [0104: Vs. Transition - Pkmn] = 3
  @>
 : Else
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: Branch End
@>

 :       : More to come

  @>Conditional Branch: Player is facing Right
   @>Show Animation: This event, [Black Apricorn (Left)]
   @>
  : Else
   @>Conditional Branch: Player is facing Up
    @>Show Animation: This event, [Black Apricorn (Front)]
    @>
   : Else
    @>
   : Branch End
   @>
  : Branch End
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: Branch End
@>Set Move Route: This event
 :              : $>Wait: 4 frame(s)
 :              : $>Graphic: "Apricorn_0', 0, 4, 2
 :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
 :              : $>Graphic: "Apricorn_0', 0, 2, 0
 :              : $>Wait: 7 frame(s)
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>

#==============================================================================
Common Event ID: 104
Common Event Name: Mining Minigame

Trigger: None

List of Event Commands:
@>Text: This wall looks like it can be dug into. Dig into it?
@>Show Choices: Yes, No
(When Cancel: Choice 2)
: When [Yes]
 @>Conditional Branch: Script: rand(100) > 25
  @>Script: pbMiningGame
  @>
 : Else
  @>Text: You dig around in the wall for a bit, but find nothing...
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>Control Self Switch: A =ON
 @>Control Variables: [0112: Dig Spot Variable] += 1
 @>
: When [No]
 @>
: Branch End
@>

 @>Text: \xn[Gold]...I'm just realizing, I never caught your name!

 @>Text: \xn[Gold]My name is Gold, I come from New Bark Town, and I'm on a journey to become a Master Trainer!
 @>Text: \xn[Gold]To that end, I'm traveling across the Kanto and Johto Regions once more to recollect their badges, and take on their respective Pokémon Leagues.
 @>Text: \xn[Gold]I've already managed to score two badges again, and I was on my way to get my third one now.
 @>Text: \xn[Gold]From the looks of it, you're going to challenge the Gym Leader here, aren't you?
 @>Call Common Event: Vs. Gold - Gyms
 @>Text: \xn[Gold]Well, how about we have a battle? Some practice before you go take on the Gym!
